description: Job Description  -Local Sales Representative, Part-Time，Flexible，Working at Home At Polymer, we would be nothing without our successful sales team. We are now seeking several local sales reps to help us sell the products and services that our customers have grown to rely on. The sales representative is mainly responsible for severing retailers from your town who are interested in B2B business. This position offers considerable profit from each successful order. Essential Responsibilities  •  Build and maintain relationships and sales revenues with assigned customers by learning and understanding their needs and providing solutions. •  Deliver sales results that meet or exceed metrics by driving lead generation, building sales pipelines and generating sales opportunities. •  Develop, monitor, and analyze data to improve sales performance across the department by making recommendations. •  Account management of medium to large accounts, including maintaining existing clients, prospecting and signing new clients.  Skills and Qualifications ·        No educational requirements ·        Excellent communication, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, and organizational skills ·        Good level in English communication Preferred Qualifications ·        3-5 years in sales within an international trade company setting ·        Knowledge and practice about international transfer ·        Social-network across varied industries, especially 3C and cosmetic industries ·        Mandarin or Cantonese speaker About the Company  Polymer is a mature company that highly participating in B2B business, specializing in the cross-border e-commerce business and international commodity trades. With groups of factory owners and foreign trade experts gathered, we aim at promoting high-quality and low-priced Chinese products to the global market, creating sufficient profit margins for local sellers, and achieving win-win cooperation with international enterprises. We had developed highly efficient transportation pipelines, steady and rich cooperation with Chinese local industries, not only our own OEM factories, but also a large number of other united factories. By advocating integrity management, we proceed worldwide trades with prestigious. Being a global enterprise, Polymer shows its inclusiveness, we highly value great cultural diversity, people of any cultural background and nationality are welcomed to join us.

Overview  As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker covers a broad spectrum of advanced solutions in all fields of research and development. All our systems and instruments are designed to improve safety of products, accelerate time-to-market and support industries in successfully enhancing quality of life. We’ve been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 50 years now. Today, worldwide more than 6,000 employees are working on this permanent challenge, at over 70 locations on all continents. Bruker Optics is a globally leading supplier of FT-(N)IR, and Raman spectrometers and microscopes.  Responsibilities guide and implement the go-to-market strategy for our FT-IR and Remote Sensing product line in the territory of China and coordinate market insights with the HQ and local management guide and convince the local sales team of our innovations, products and sales strategies train the local sales team in how to present and sell our products by addressing our unique selling points guide and convince the local sales team with impressive demonstrations of our products in front of prospects and customers develop and roll out measures for raising revenue with our products present our solutions on seminars and conferences Initialize and trigger marketing activities to further increase the awareness of our products suggest improvements and enhancements to our products to strengthen their position and establish them in new markets this position reports to the Country Manager Bruker Optics CN Qualifications several years of experience in the management of products or projects knowledge with Raman or Remote Sensing is expected master’s degree in technical engineering or natural sciences good presentation skills to communicate technical innovations and sales initiatives to the project teams, and country organizations globally ability and willingness to travel of at least 50% working time motivative/leadership attitude
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: 主要职责： 【客户经理】 公共关系 1、负责进网测试相关部门信息收集、客户关系维护、技术产业政策推广、技术交流等，提升我司公司形象与产品品牌； 2、跟踪研究国家通信产品进网管理政策及管理办法，推进公司新技术新产品的政府准入许可； 3、建设公司内部进网平台，完善沟通机制，梳理流程； 4、参与公司产品进网业务以及相关应急事件处理； 5、对接进网测试等相关客户单位。  政企客户经理 1、市场的销售策划及任务达成；通过拓展、维护客户关系，建设渠道合作伙伴关系，持续提升公司品牌，实现营造良好的市场经营环境； 2、依据公司战略要求，完成所负责行业、区域的各项业绩目标； 3、高级客户关系的拓展与维护，准确把握、深入挖掘客户需求，分析对公司各类产品方案的潜在需求； 4、行业用户的市场分析与策划及竞争对手分析； 5、整合公司资源，实现重大项目的信息挖掘、突破与执行落地； 6、承担渠道拓展和管理的任务；与合作伙伴共同配合完成业绩目标与市场突破； 7、重大市场活动的策划，组织各类展会、参观交流等，拓展公司品牌，提升市场形象。  技术客户经理 1、建立、维系、提升客户关系 2、组织、策划、实施、评估各种类型客户关系活动 3、线索挖掘、商机管理、竞标、合同谈判、合同签订等营销全流程工作 4、完成竞争信息的管理、策略实施及评估 5、突破空白市场、扩大市场份额 6、提升公司品牌形象，实施精准营销  高端客户接待 1、负责全球客户来访接待及商务活动方案的策划及资源组织协调工作 2、负责全球客户来访国内期间高层会见安排与商务活动方案的落实实施 3、负责全球展会接待方案策划与组织实施，国际性大型会议的会务组织与接待工作  【MKT技术】 MKT-技术 1、负责重点国家的市场策略、产品策略的分析和制定，并对各项策略有效推进、落地、运用以达成业绩目标； 2、参与各种MKT活动并演示公司的产品技术方案，与客户进行技术交流，配合客户经理开展市场开拓和推广活动；负责技术营销活动及品牌活动的策划、支撑、组织及实施，比如workshop、宣讲交流、样板点参观等； 3、准备技术产品和解决方案介绍资料，配合客户经理参与客户沟通会，理解、分析并评估客户的具体需求和项目可行性，跟踪客户需求；根据客户需求和一线信息，推进产品研发和方案竞争力提升； 4、负责项目投标，包括标前引导、投标组织、技术方案、项目澄清和谈判、合同签订等。  无线产品 1、负责无线产品区域市场的信息收集和整理分析、市场机会点的发掘，制定市场规划和策略；  2、分析区域市场需求及竞争环境分析，发掘普遍性的及中长期需求，支撑产品中长期规划、与解决方案的制定；  3、策划与高层客户的技术交流等，通过交流获取客户关键需求，把握客户需求发展趋势。  MKT 1、负责无线产品区域市场的信息收集和整理分析、市场机会点的发掘，制定市场规划和策略；  2、分析区域市场需求及竞争环境分析，发掘普遍性的及中长期需求，支撑产品中长期规划、与解决方案的制定；  3、策划与高层客户的技术交流等，通过交流获取客户关键需求，把握客户需求发展趋势。  云视频产品MKT 1、负责视频产品的产品或者区域市场规划、制定落地策略和行动计划，确保业绩目标达成； 2、负责视频产品的产品或者区域市场信息收集、客户分析、商机挖掘等工作； 3、负责视频产品相关重点项目运作，包括引导策略、赢标策略和竞争策略，确保项目中标； 4、负责视频产品重点项目投标中的方案设计、方案制作、标书应答、技术澄清、BOQ配置与优化； 5、负责视频产品相关产品或者区域竞争对手、市场地图等信息搜集和分析。  政企产品及方案 1、负责市场机会挖掘，具备敏锐的市场洞察力，负责收集、发现、提炼和挖掘市场机会，完成推进储备项目的相关工作； 2、负责技术方案的宣讲交流能力，并能够清晰的阐述解决方案的内容、亮点以及基本功能的展示/演示； 3、负责项目投标，包括标前引导，投标组织，技术方案的撰写，项目澄清等； 4、负责对收集到的市场竞情和行业发展趋势，行业标准信息进行整理和分析； 5、负责输出满足客户需求的技术方案，并支撑方案对应产品的商务工作（包括产品商务策略、商务价格的分析和建议）； 6、负责结合行业发展趋势行业、产品经营业绩分析工作； 7、负责将市场策略有效推进、落地； 8、负责渠道活动、品牌活动及行业活动的策划、支撑、组织及实施，比如行业年会，渠道沙龙，样板点参观等。  【MKT商务】 终端商务 1、深度参与终端营销项目运作从商机到收款的全流程商务管理，防控项目风险，提升经营质量； 2、参与商务模式策划，合同合规管理，客户资信管理，外汇风险等工作。  MKT-商务 1、负责所在市场的信息汇总、整理和分析；负责国家商务模式信息搜集、分析和维护更新； 2、负责项目投标中的商务策划分析，包括市场分析、竞争分析、盈利提升等； 3、负责项目投标中的商务定价，包括成本分析、项目风险分析、定价策略、报价设计、定价会召开等；负责商务方案输出与澄清； 4、负责项目运作中的商务谈判、合同风险优化、合同签订和生效等； 5、负责合同变更、废止，负责项目商务复盘； 6、负责商务流程和规范的落地，推进代表处和项目组的规范运作。  政企商务 1、负责公司产品的市场商务策略拟定，区域/行业市场商务策划，价格策略制定等； 2、负责项目商务工作，包括商务应标、报价支持，成本价格分析，市场竞情分析等； 3、负责项目成本计算、成本优化等，进行经营分析和盈利能力提升； 4、负责市场基础信息搜集、竞情信息搜集、商务模式整理及分析等； 5、负责商务合同制作和审核，合同管理与风险管控； 6、大项目支撑，商务决策和商务谈判等； 7、业务流程制定、优化、实施推进和管理； 8、综合商务工具的开发和使用。  【技术支持工程师】 1、负责国际/国内无线/有线/承载等产品的技术交付工作，负责开通、维护、巡检、项目组织等提供现场技术支持 ； 2、负责国际/国内产品的版本升级、故障处理、网络优化方案制定审核； 3、负责国际/国内产品的技术支持，工程开通、维护和运营支撑等工作； 4、参与产品方案编写、方案评审和客户培训等工作； 5、远程登录或远程电话技术指导解决现场问题；  任职要求： 【客户经理】 公共关系 1、有很强的学习能力，可以快速对公司通信产品深入了解，并且对通信产品技术体制、行业发展情况有主动学习能力； 2、有很强的沟通、协调能力；针对外部客户有拓展和维护能力，有效的向客户传达我司战略经营目的； 3、针对内部各部门，可以有效的协调各方面资源，准确、快速的传达内部外信息，保证测试工作顺利进行。  政企客户经理 1、硕士以上学历，通信、信息、电子、网络、计算机等相关专业； 2、具备相关行业信息化营销实习工作或项目工作经验者优先； 3、技术背景扎实，善于进行技术交流； 4、具备快速反应能力，抗压能力强； 5、有激情，责任心强，诚信务实，有较强的沟通协调能力及团队合作精神。  技术客户经理 1、应届本科生或研究生，通信、信息、电子、网络、计算机等相关专业； 2、具备较强的成就动机和优秀的沟通能力；  3、具备优秀的应变抗压能力，学习能力和执行力； 4、具备良好团队合作和组织协调能力；   5、认同中兴通讯企业价值观； 6、英语听说读写流利。  高端客户接待 1、应届本科生或研究生，通讯技术、工商管理、国际关系、新闻传播、外语等相关专业； 2、形象气质佳，有亲和力，普通话标准，英语口语流利，可作为工作语言； 3、具备良好的沟通与人际理解力，良好的团队合作精神与抗压力，具有较强的成就动机及创新思维； 4、熟练使用office办公软件，Adobe类图像处理及视频编辑软件的基础运用； 5、曾担任学生会、社团干部或参与过校内外大型活动的组织、策划、及实施工作。  【MKT技术】 MKT-技术 1、通信及电子、计算机等相关专业本科及以上学历； 2、具备熟练的外语（包括英语或小语种）听、说、读、写能力； 3、具备团队协作精神及快速学习能力和开放心态，有良好的组织策划、沟通协调、推动落实能力、抗压能力； 4、能接受海外常驻或海外长期出差。  无线产品 1、计算机、通信等相关专业硕士及以上毕业； 2、英语听说读写能力强，能达到工作语言要求； 3、思维清晰，组织能力感染力强，善于团队协作；有一定的信息收集与分析能力； 4、能接受中长期出差任务。  MKT 1、计算机、通信等相关专业硕士及以上毕业； 2、英语听说读写能力强，能达到工作语言要求； 3、思维清晰，组织能力感染力强，善于团队协作；有一定的信息收集与分析能力； 4、能接受中长期出差任务。  云视频产品MKT 1、电子、自动化、计算机、通讯等专业，本科及以上学历； 2、良好的学习能力，能够快速掌握新产品技能和知识； 3、个人综合素质良好，能够接受为达成业绩目标承受相应的工作压力和工作强度； 4、具备良好的沟通能力，能够推动内外部资源为达成目标服务； 5、具有良好的宣讲能力，掌握一定的宣讲技巧； 6、良好的英语听、说、读、写能力； 7、能海外中长期出差（每年海外出差时间在6个月左右）； 8、服从工作安排，做事认真踏实细致，有较好的团队协作精神。  政企产品及方案 1、通信、信息、电子、网络、计算机等相关专业硕士及以上学历。 2、具有较强的工作主动性、团队协作和沟通能力。 3、对ICT领域的相关技术有一定的了解，熟悉云计算，SDN，大数据，虚拟化、分布式数据库，物联网，视频多媒体等相关技术。 4、对企业信息化有一定了解。 5、具备快速学习能力和开放心态，有良好的组织策划、沟通协调、推动落实能力。 6、具备技术方案文档、PTT等的撰写能力，并能够清晰的阐述技术方案的原理、技术亮点以及产品的基本功能展示/演示。  【MKT商务】 终端商务 1、会计、国际贸易、经济学等相关专业硕士及以上学历； 2、有较丰富的财务管理、国际贸易、金融、法律等方面的专业知识，至少在其中一方面有比较全面的职业技能； 3、良好的沟通能力和良好的团队合作精神； 4、做事认真、踏实，学习能力强，具有一定的创造力； 5、英语听说读写优秀，CET-6。  MKT-商务 1、通信、财经、国贸、经济、管理、会计、语言等相关专业本科及以上学历； 2、英语（或小语种），具备良好的听、说、读、写能力并能够作为工作语言； 3、良好的表达能力、沟通能力、较好的商务谈判能力、数理逻辑分析与推理能力；细心、严谨、有责任心； 4、快速适应新环境的能力，喜欢跨文化的工作环境，并能够适应海外工作和生活。  政企商务 1、通讯、电子和计算机软硬件等专业，硕士； 2、具备通讯、电子和计算机软硬件等专业基本知识； 3、具备很强的逻辑分析和数据处理能力； 4、具有强烈的责任心、服务意识和团队观念，具备快速学习能力和开放心态，有良好的组织策划、沟通协调能力； 5、具有长期从事商务工作的意愿和定力。 【技术支持工程师】 1、2022届本科、硕士应届毕业生，通信、电子或计算机等专业；  2、性格开朗，工作有激情，具备良好的沟通表达能力，具备服务意识和团队合作意识； 3、志存高远、乐于挑战，渴望成功，希望在不同国度不同文化中积累跨国工作经验；
industries: Telecommunications, Market Research, and Marketing and Advertising

description: Who You'll Work With  Work within Great China region to extract enterprise customer requirements and existing franchise architectures and then develop an overarching architectural vision for Great China Theater. This team is tasked with driving the growth of our Enterprise Networking hardware and software solutions business and assist Cisco, as we continue to evolve as a market leader, preserving top-line margins and creating offers and solutions with differentiated advantages over the competition.  The primary goal of the Great China Enterprise Networking Sales Team is to grow our annual Enterprise Networking business and have a broad impact on the adoption of our enterprise software products. This will be accomplished through direct customer sales activity, cultivating relationships with Cisco’s strategic sales partners and evangelizing the product portfolio with customers and peers. If you are ready to be part of entrepreneurial culture, focused on accountability for all aspects of the vision, strategy, execution and measurement model, then this team is for you.  What You'll Do  The Great China Sales organization is looking for our next game changing team member. You will be part of a team that drives Cisco’s Enterprise Networking product portfolio along with a focus on driving Cisco’s Software Defined Access adoption within the service provider enterprise network environment.  You will be responsible for selling Cisco’s Enterprise Networking hardware (Routing, Switching and Wireless) and software products to a targeted group of service provider customers.  Role & Responsibilities Responsible for establishing customer relationships and leading the pursuit of EN Networking and SDA opportunities to meet or exceed established goals. Develops EN Networking account plans for assigned account(s) to drive strategic, customer-facing EN Networking and SDA engagements that require creative and complex solutions Establish partnerships with account team peers in the assigned account(s) to integrate EN Networking & SDA sales strategies, manage forecasts and provide insight into market and business opportunities. Actively work with strategic partners to develop sales engagement plans. Inter-lock with the BE teams to provide field-based feedback on existing solutions that accelerate consumption of EN Networking solutions. Drive strategic, customer-facing SDA engagements that require creative and complex solutions.  Responsibilities Understand business requirements for customer base and be able to translate them into technical requirements. Lead definition and drive the development of product in conjunction with Cisco Development resources. Develop and deliver on high level, complex technology specific product line strategies and major market programs and initiatives. Create and drive technology strategy and collateral content for theater product introductions. Work within Business unit to drive evolution of the enterprise networking portfolio in line with specific theatre needs, aligning where appropriate with global initiatives Take a process oriented approach to definition and management of product requirements Integrate customer and market requirements with Cisco products to create future solutions. Evangelize product and solutions strategies to internal stakeholder, filed teams and external partners and customers. Understand competitor's positioning and strategies and develop Cisco competitive technology service strategy and positioning. Provide detailed architectural solutions, technical and sales support. Serve as the subject matter expert and key technical advisor to the product management and sales engineering teams Provide support to other architecture members in helping to deliver a cohesive Cisco strategy across the Great China Theater. Actively participate as a specialist on assigned Virtual Team(s) and/or Solutions Team(s).   Who You Are  You have strong sales skills, you are technically proficient, you are able to demonstrate an ability to influence and you can articulate Cisco’s value to a large or small audience.  Minimum Qualifications 10+ years of Professional Selling, Software & Hardware Solutions Track record of exceeding quotas Leadership experience strongly encouraged Demonstrating ability to work cross-functionally with multiple organizations and GEO/Field sales personnel Ability to work effectively, add value as a team member and assume a leadership role for the team Fluent in written and spoken English and Mandarin, Cantonese is a strong plus  Why Cisco  We connect everything people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.  We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.  We Are Cisco
industries: Computer Hardware, Computer Software, and Computer Networking

description: Job Profile Summary Grade IResponsible for delivering the indirect sales strategy and financial performance targets including Sales Volume, Gross Margin and Overdue, managing local distributor partners and intermediaries/resellers in the sales territory or geography, finding prospect partners, coaching distributors and monitoring their financial position to ensure long term sustainable value for the company. The scope of the role will influence the grade – this can include financial accountability, geographical scope, leadership responsibilities and overall level of responsibility.  Job Advert Job Purpose The role is accountable for delivery of shared business objectives in the given portfolio, including Volume and GM performance targets, as well as other activation targets like in-store penetration, share of wallet and training etc.. An information source of the latest “voice of customer”, the competitor activities and the change of local market. Key Accountabilities Workshop development: Work with Key Account sales team and planning team to define a local area business plan including target workshops, coverage, sales target, activities etc. Understand Key Account sales contract terms, policy and agreed offer Prepare specific workshop value selling offer and sell to the target customer. Workshop management: Understand, build relationship with, and influence customer in order to gain commitment for the activities proposed. Implement activities aligned to customer needs and company strategy to maintain the good relationship with existing customers. Actively defends and grows existing customer share of wallet through needs based and effective use of our offer. Holds regular meetings to agree and track KPIs with customers. Coordinate with Key Account team on workshop activation planning for responsible area Manage designated service provider for workshop activation if needed. Customer and market insights: manage an updated database and maintain close relationship locally. Understand customer needs and competitor’s approach and provide feedback to company. Represent “voice of customer” in the company in order to improve our approach. Requirements Bachelor’s degree, with major of sales & marketing related is preferred. At least 3-5 years sales & marketing experience. More than 2 years sales & marketing experience, automotive aftermarket experience is plus; Demonstrated track record of driving growth in a very competitive market environment; Working experience in Lubes industry is preferred. Good at building up relationship with customers Strong implementation capability and customer management capabilities Coordination skill to ensure the teamwork of various partners in delivery of effective trade-up programs. Able to translate customer needs into customer propositions, and to sell into the customer and business in a persuasive way We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  Entity Customers & Products  Job Family Group Sales Group  Relocation available No  Travel Required Yes - up to 75%  Country China  About BP CUSTOMER AND PRODUCTS We’re gearing up for the future. At bp our goal for C&P is to deliver the future of mobility, energy and services for our customers by innovating with new business models and service platforms.  C&P will become a hub, housing our midstream, lubricants, aviation, sale of chemicals, mobility and convenience, marketing and our next-generation businesses, making it a highly integrated and interconnected organisation. And with safety being our core value, our commitment to safe and reliable operations will never change.  Want to join the team? This means: being customer-centric, agile and responsive to changing customer needs and dynamic markets focusing on growth and development of customer offers optimising the chemicals and fuels value chains to maximise integrated value contributing to the reduction of carbon intensity of the products we create, and sell, by 50% by 2050 or sooner creating strategic partnerships that drive long-term value for C&P being digitally enabled and empowered by customer insights and data to deliver solutions. Experience Level Intermediate
industries: Oil & Energy

description: Job Profile Summary Responsible for delivering the indirect sales strategy and financial performance targets including Sales Volume, Gross Margin and Overdue, managing local distributor partners and intermediaries/resellers in the sales territory or geography, finding prospect partners, coaching distributors and monitoring their financial position to ensure long term sustainable value for the company. The scope of the role will influence the grade – this can include financial accountability, geographical scope, leadership responsibilities and overall level of responsibility.  Job Advert Purpose of role ： The Workshop Sales Specialist role exists to manage local top workshop partners in the sales territory. The role is accountable for delivery of the PCO IWS indirect workshop sales strategy and execution of market offer strategy. The role is also responsible of finding and developing prospect partners, and finally contribute to territory distributor’s sales performance. Accountabilities Implement country PCO IWS indirect business strategy within territory by translating it into clear business plans. Deliver IWS channel strategy by developing new customer and continuously improving existing customer in store share in top workshops. Work closely with IWS Territory Manager and Distributor Sales team to secure and improve Castrol market share in workshop level, and finally contribute significant financial performance to distributors. Leverage cross function resources and joint approach for the best outcome. Develop, agree (both internally and externally) and implement the market offer strategy with the Channel partner, providing permanent support in all areas of its contents, and in particular regarding: sales capability (skills and knowledge) b. customer offer deployment, coverage and satisfaction  c. financial Return on Investment and cash flow performance  d. brand representation and compliance  e. HSSE and Ethical compliance Collect the information about the key customer database and manage the pipeline of key customer development. Develop and manage the business relationship with the key customers in the area by using the tools and resources smartly to deliver the desired business results. Share field findings and experience at team level, extracting comparable information. Improve and deliver customer experience in targeted sectors and customer groups. Ensure delivery of our promises by seeking continuous improvement and efficiency in all operations making sure the voice of the customer is represented in every decision we make. Drive standardization of our sales offers in line with our basic customer offer. Ensure that all activities conducted through 3rd parties or intermediaries in country comply fully with our own CoC and local competition legalisation. Ensure compliance with country regulations, bp Group, Segment and regional policies and standards. Experience & Expertise Minimum 3 years working experience in distributor sales and management Track record of delivery of sales targets and performance Experience/track record/confidence representing the company externally and dealing professionally with distributors and workshops. Experience of managing negotiations at senior level. Capability to work independently but also skillful on teamwork. Ability to develop and implement strategic and tactical business plans. Ability to be hands on and drive the business with direct responsibility Flexibility of thought and action to be able to respond to changing market environments and dynamic business situations Adapted for frequent business travel We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. At bp our goal for C&P is to deliver the future of mobility, energy and services for our customers by innovating with new business models and service platforms.  C&P will become a hub, housing our midstream, lubricants, aviation, sale of chemicals, mobility and convenience, marketing and our next-generation businesses, making it a highly integrated and interconnected organisation. And with safety being our core value, our commitment to safe and reliable operations will never change.  Want to join the team? This means: being customer-centric, agile and responsive to changing customer needs and dynamic markets focusing on growth and development of customer offers optimising the chemicals and fuels value chains to maximise integrated value contributing to the reduction of carbon intensity of the products we create, and sell, by 50% by 2050 or sooner creating strategic partnerships that drive long-term value for C&P being digitally enabled and empowered by customer insights and data to deliver solutions. Deliver consistently accurate forecasting information in order for the Production teams to plan accordingly. Monitor and report actual sales in the region and make forecasts on a client/ project level and establish targets for product mix, sales volume, market, share and business development and monitor the performance of the sales organisation against these goals to pursue the annual target achievement. And to identify and contact major leads and to develop these into projects, aligned with the company's competitive advantages. Further develop the local sales and make sure the market is effectively and efficiently covered and monitored. Proactively manage key customer accounts to maximize potential revenue and secure future sales opportunities. Provide the support to distributor, together with the distributors identify potential training needs both within product training as well as sales training and arrange training programs, in order to assist distributors to build a strong sales forces, dedicated to selling out products. And actively work with customer satisfaction, investigate and feedback customer complaints and take corrective action when necessary. Actively work with increasing sales within present segments as well as develop sales within new segment. Lead and develop the sales team, includes recruitment and competence development of staff, maintaining and further developing the company culture and retention of staff then further influence the distributors. Work together and support by marketing activities to drive sales growth such as exhibitions and customer and distributor seminars. Ensure that the distributors and the staff are acting in accordance with our code of conduct.  The Successful Applicant  Bachelor Degree in Sales and Marketing or trade with interest in technical products or degree in engineering with additional competencies in sales & marketing or trade. Solid experience in the construction equipment industry and extensive experience from sales management in China Proven track record of sales team management with leadership experience. Ability to manage distributors and assist them to build strong sales teams who are dedicated to selling products and extensive experience from industrial sales both direct and through distributors. Ability to build relationships with key customers that are at high levels within their organizations Ability to develop him/ herself as well as distributors and staff. Ability and willingness to take unpopular decision for the good of the company. Excellent Communications and presentation skills Good command of written and spoken English Honest and responsible Knowledge of both European and Asian business and organizational culture. Customer oriented and flexible Quality oriented Basic Financial skills Personal characteristics a self-starter with developed entrepreneurial and leadership skills Driven and business oriented Assertive Pro-active with good interpersonal skills Result oriented and high performance Used to work under pressure  What's On Offer  Team leading responsibility, full authority for marketing development, attractive salary package. description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Overview  The Territory Sales Representative is primarily responsible for creating new and expansion business in Strategic Territory accounts to meet/exceed financial and business objectives.  This job is assigned a sales quota and performance is measured by meeting or exceeding quarterly and annual targets within a defined list of accounts.  This position reports to China Territory Hub Sales Manager and will integrate with a sales team that includes customer success specialists, partners, technical sales, client services, and marketing, to drive growth within their assigned accounts through new, cross-sell and upsell opportunities. Database management a plus  Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience

description: The manager of sales coordination is responsible for increasing the sales of the village.  He directly manages a team of profit centres (boutique, spa, discovery, ski service - depending on the village) and is also responsible, in a cross- functional manner, for coordination and results of the sales areas of the village, such as VRL / VSL, sale of wine, bar sales, sports training, family services requiring a fee... He will support HQ sales and marketing incl. sales account maintenance, new account development, local market insight, offer recommendation, marketing content production, MICE group resort coordination etc.  As a manager of proximity, he accompanies and motivates the sales forces in the village to increase local sales performance and may, occasionally, participate in sales. Perimeter: all points of sale of the village, internalized or subcontracted.  He reports to the Chief of Village (CDV) and dot line to HQ Commercial Development Director Supervision and tracking of sales ·        In resort sales: o   Is responsible for the PNL and internal control of all profit centres that report to him directly, communicating the local sales objectives, establishing/proposing action plans and tracking results. o   Assists the Manager (RDS) with analysis of the customer base before the stay (with occupancy information), obtains information about their consumption behaviours (via Gouvernail) And makes sure of adaptation of the offer as a result in respect of service standards o   Alerts the chief of village and Development Manager for local sales of the zone or the contact in the zone in case of customer dissatisfaction or non-placement of the product in the profit centres, which he manages o   Is familiar with the contracts within his perimeter and ensures that they are executed accordingly o   Within the framework of subcontracting, is the principal contact of subcontractors in the village, monitors their activities and is responsible for their proper integration into the commercial dynamics of the village   ·        Local sales and marketing: o   Support indirect sales team in sales account maintenance and new local account development; o   Update HQ with local marketing insight, competitor information and performance; o   Provide offer/product recommendation following market trend; o   Coordinate and align between HQ and resort on markting campaigns and events, sales promotion and activities; o   Support marketing content production in resort; o   Support MICE group resort coordination.Makes sure of respect of product standards and pricing policies in the village (including respect of rules on discounts, gratuity...) Sales coordination ·        Is the conductor of development of local sales in the village by identification of sales opportunities, while also optimizing margin and sharing resources ·        Is responsible for implementation of the sales policy at the village in line with the Club Med spirit and for the resources necessary for attaining the objectives of each point-of-sale (product offering, merchandising, teams) ·        Develops action plans in coordination with the Room Division Manager or front desk manager, to draw local clients, from outside the village, validates them with a the CDV after consultation of the zone services and organizes the implementation of them ·        Supervises the weekly cross-functional sales committee meeting ·        Supervises the incentives and sales challenges, organizes the sharing of best practices ·        Shares his diagnostics and action plans with the zone services, proposes changes of the offer (product, pricing policy, communication...) to maximize sales ·        Makes proposals to the Meetings & Events Manager regarding sales activities and assists him in handling requests ·        Sets the stage for sales activities by coordinating with the Ambiance Manager and/or the events teams of the village Management and coaching of the sales team ·        Coordinates and assists the Village teams to develop sales ·        Supervises, challenges and assists the teams of the profit centres under his responsibility with their action plans ·        Plays a coaching role with the sales forces of the point-of-sale in the village in collaboration with the Trainers Team (UDT) and the VTMs of the zone ·        Identifies profiles of salespeople in the village to develop them and make them relays for sales in the village ·        Maintains the teams during the “win over” phase: identifies signs of lagging motivation, creates conditions of motivation and sustains them ·        Communicates objectives defined by the zone and evaluates the managers of profit centres managed directly ·        Is consulted by the chief of village for evaluation of the managers of other services on attainment, or absence thereof, of "business" objectives ·        To successfully carry out cross-functional coordination, the Sales Coordination Manager works closely with the Managers of each service and the Sector Managers (Room division, F&B Manager, Ambiance Manager etc.) He proposes sales action plans and ensures motivation of the teams and of the “all salespeople” global dynamic   v CA/HD result, gross margin for HD, GM Feedback all profit centres, respect of Quality standards for implementation of action plans for optimisation of sales and margin Professional skills: v Excellent technical proficiency and in the domain of sales in the broader sense v Excellent capacities for team management and team coordination v Capacities of analysis, synthesis, structuring v Ability to communicate and present with conviction  Personal qualities: v Very good relational and teaching skills, attentive v Results-oriented v Rigour and organization v Autonomy, ability to make decisions and adapt v Leadership, charisma v Good negotiator v Reliability v Ability to see the big picture v Energy, dynamism, persistence, tenacity IT and languages v Fluent Chinese and English v Strong proficiency with IT tools (Office Suite)

Required Qualifications:  More than 5 years working experience, preferably in medical industry, either as commercial role, technical or clinical role. Good command of English both in oral and written Good business acumen, sensitivity to the dynamics in market place, with good strategic thinking capacity; Good presentation skills Bachelor and above degree, preferably in Clinical Medical background  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. description: Job Description Summary  As a Senior Account Sales, you will develop & implement One GE Healthcare sales strategy by maintaining commercial relationships/alliances with Accounts at zone level, e.g. hospitals, hospital groups, government bodies or Group Purchasing Organizations. It's a role that will be responsible for maintaining a detailed understanding of assigned accounts’ business and keeping GE Healthcare Zone, Region & Product management informed and appropriately involved. You will be expected to lead & close multimodality and single product deals in their assigned accounts.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Financial Performance1. Achieve sales and orders volumes at the target prices in assigned accounts/territory.  2. Coordinate orders and sales forecasts within the applicable sales funnel tools and reports for in their assigned territory/accounts in conjunction with Product Sales Specialist/product Specialists. Account Management1. Maintain relationships, develop a business strategy, and maximize business opportunities for all GE Healthcare businesses, products & services within allocated accounts/territory (or within defined care area/department scope). Represent OneGEHC in the account or care area/department and acts as a primary customer point of contact in the allocated accounts/territory. Provide on-going feedback to management, product teams, services and marketing.2. Maintain Go-to-Market plans in conjunction with Zone cross functional and multi-product teams to achieve targets and grow GE’s share of customer investments in capital, diagnostics and operational expenditures.3. Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction through consistent high quality interactions with customer management. Build long term strategic alliance with portfolio of accounts to continue to add value, and promote Service offerings to identify and escalate commercial service needs to drive customer NPS.4. In cooperation with Product teams and Marketing, drive One GE Healthcare promotional events in assigned territory. Be aware of customer segmentation and promote offerings relevant to each client’s segment. Opportunity Management1. Prospecting for new customers and business opportunities in addition to growing and maintaining the existing customer portfolio. 2. Prioritize new leads to create a balanced sales funnel for future sales.3. Lead and leverage Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialists, Care Area or Category Leaders, Service Operations and other Company resources to provide the necessary technical, clinical and business content to create a competitive differentiation.  4. Coordinate One GE Healthcare team on assigned accounts in order to deliver solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations.5. Lead & coordinate multi-P&L proposals, preparing sales quotations, planning customer meetings and demonstrating equipment capabilities across diagnostic product portfolio with relevant Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialist and other sales support staff.6. Ensure order and configuration quality at the point of entry to ensure accuracy, configuration integrity and that all requirements are tied to documented customer inputs.7. Lead successful negotiation and closure of multi P&L opportunities, interfacing with all key buyer influencers. Assist Product Sales Specialists in negotiation and deal closure of single product deals as required. 8. Promote point of sale service contracts and financing solutions and drive margin through selling value and achieving price targets.GE Product & Market awareness1. Develop a solid knowledge of GE product and service portfolio and competitors’ products.2. Develop and maintain expertise of market and technology trends in order to understand customer issues and challenges as well as educating customer on their unmet clinical and business needs.3. Develop and maintain deep understanding of CxO level business and clinical needs and how GE provide solutions/offerings to meet these needs differently from the competition.Compliance1. Adhere to and uphold highest standards of compliance to relevant international and local Regulatory and GE Healthcare Promotional Codes2. Adhere to all applicable GE and GE Healthcare compliance policies, codes and training requirements3. Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required.  Qualifications / Requirements  1. Education to Bachelor Degree level or the equivalent of four years of sales experience.  2. 2 years of strategic sales experience.  3. 2 years experience in healthcare.  4. Proven key account management and project planning skills.  5. Strong customer focus and desire to continuously improve expertise  6. Well developed listening, influencing, interpersonal and networking skills to drive collaborative culture at all levels; High level presentation skills; able to present ideas to customers in a way that produces understanding and impact.  Quality Specific Goals1. Aware of and comply with the GEHC Quality Manual, Quality Management System, Quality Management Policy, Quality Goals, and applicable laws and regulations as they apply to this job type/position2. Complete all planned Quality & Compliance training within the defined deadlines3. Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required4. Knowledge and understanding of all Global Privacy and Anti-Competition Policies 5. Knowledge and understanding of all Environmental Health Policies (including but not limited to GE Healthcare EHS Policies, GE Healthcare Fleet Rules, etc.) and operate within them to ensure that no company policy or Country / Int’l Law is broken 6. Drive continuous improvement on all related processes, work instructions, and procedures to ensure ongoing standardization and simplification of the Quality Management System.  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support. Previous motion control or mechatronics product knowledge, have existing customer base is preferred 运动控制相关产品的基本知识.  EXPERIENCE: 经验要求 2~3 years working experience, ideally in sales or sales support related to direct machine OEM. 2~3年工作经验 Experienced in motion control（Encoder、Motor、Drive）or mechatronic systems is required. 运动控制相关产品（编码器，电机，驱动）销售经验 Knowledge in Semiconductor/Microelectronics ,  Robotics、Surgical robotics 、Sat-COM、AGV is a plus. 熟悉测试测量,半导体制造, 工业机器人，手术机器人，卫星通讯，AGV等市场  PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:个人要求 Self motivation and eager to learn Well organized 诚实诚恳 Team oriented 富有团队合作精神 Proactive and responsive interpersonal skills and demonstrated performance in dealing with internal and external customers 处理内外部事务时,具备主动且负责的沟通技巧.

description: The Dell Technologies portfolio of emerging technologies is enough to get your pulse racing. But our customers are our heartbeat and deserve human interaction that is special and unique to their technological needs. Our Inside Sales Account Manager team is the driving force behind our high-level customer interaction.  Join us as a Account Manager on our Inside Sales team in Xiamento do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.  What You’ll Achieve  As an Inside Sales Account Manager, you will be responsible for driving sales for our ground-breaking products by building positive relationships with customers through digital communication. You will own the brand of Dell Technologies, ensuring every customer interaction is tailored and outstanding.  You Will Gain new accounts and seek opportunities in your account territory Manage small- to medium-sized accounts Stay informed of industry trends to help resolve specific market challenges Recommend business solutions supported with data Take the first step towards your dream career  Essential Requirements  Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Ability to articulate the value proposition of our product/service offerings Potential to use multiple sales tools simultaneously to complete sales transactions Ability to establish relationships with customers and partners Desirable Requirements 2-4 years relevant experience Here’s our story; now tell us yours  Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.  What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.  We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.  You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here. description: SHINE Program Highlights An intense 18 months SHINE Program requiring three challenging rotational assignments with a training curriculum to develop both leadership and commercial skills. This program is designed to attract, develop & retain commercial experts and future commercial leaders for SABIC. Program Design: A 18 months Program Three Job Rotation Assignments Leadership and functional trainings Coaching/Mentoring by business managers Regional exposures  JOB RESPONSIBILITIES  Sales Rotation: Understand the assigned market/industry/area and identify the value chains, build connections and maintain relationships with customers handle daily affairs and manage the business. Cooperate supporting functions to provide good service to customers. Find opportunities to develop new customers and new business, understand our products and study the relevant applications, translate the voice of customer into material requirements, and convert the opportunities to orders. Well utilize relevant systems and tools to conduct business routine and data management, facilitate sales promotion activities for business development, and handle customers' demand in all business aspects to drive continuous improvement of customer experience. Marketing Development Rotation: Analyze assigned industry/area to screen opportunities and understand customers’ needs, specify Specialties' solution in new applications by selling value propositions, make effective communication with customer to build targets for new biz development and build pipelines for continuous growth. Leverage multiple internal & external resources and collaborate with them to follow up the targeted opportunities to make sure real sales result, know industry & technology development trend, and learn new product/application knowledge and emerging market to explore new development areas. Business Operations Rotation: Learn and utilize systems/tools to manage daily operations, such as pricing decision and price management, demand planning and supply management. Work with commercial and SCM to ensure data accuracy, effectively formulate and execute operation plan for better company benefits. Make recommendation/proposal to improve/optimize existing tools and processes to help with operation and commercial teams improving productivity and optimizing operations.  JOB REQUIREMENTS BA above degree and preferred major in Science and Engineer 3-5 years working experience Demonstrated Success in Sales and/or Marketing Roles Strong Communication & Interpersonal Skills Project leadership Analytical Ability Good industry knowledge Change Agility Be flexible to work in other cities during rotation (Shanghai, Suzhou, Shenzhen and Guangzhou)
industries: Chemicals

description: About Oracle NetSuite: Oracle NetSuite is the world's leading provider of cloud-based business management software. NetSuite helps companies manage core business processes with a single, fully integrated system covering ERP/financials, CRM, E-commerce, inventory and more. Named by Gartner as the fastest growing financial management software vendor on a global basis, NetSuite netted two prestigious CODiE Awards in 2013 from the SIIA including Best Financial Management Solution and Best Cloud Infrastructure.  Working at Oracle NetSuite: Picture yourself building a successful career at Oracle NetSuite—working alongside talented, driven individuals to help fast-growing, mid-size organizations and large enterprises achieve their business goals with the world’s #1 cloud-based business management suite, including ERP, Financials, CRM, Ecommerce and PSA.   Responsibilities: Develop strategic territory plan for achieving annual quota and business growth by hitting your monthly, quarterly and annual revenue targets. You must be capable to drive demand generation with multi-strategy and orchestrate internal and external resource to achieve pipeline generation goal. As Snr Sales Professional, you need to be comfortable and capable to operate fundamental demand generation activity, social selling, as well as leading large scale of demand generation campaign. Engage with prospective clients to position Oracle NetSuite solutions via electronic and face-to-face customer meetings; Prospect, consult and sell business application solutions and related services to prospective new mid-market business customers; Work with your prospects to learn their business, understand their needs and determine how the NetSuite solution can best address their issues; Build successful customer relationship/ partnership and success references in Hong Kong Market Capable to maintain Sales forecast accuracy and consistency with in-depth account coverage, deal management and win plan. Be able to effectively and efficiently use internal system to manage pipeline and forecast. Strategic Leadership – leverage and Orchestrate available internal and external resources including solution consulting, professional services, marketing, industry experts and management to drive success of GTM and Sales execution with Objective to over-achieve quota.   Requirements: Hunter mentality with demonstrated success building pipeline, progressing pipeline and wining deals; Be able to think Short – Mid- Long term Market Development. Tenacious and extremely results driven. You want to be at the top of the leader board and hate losing. We are looking for quota killer, not quota achievers; ERP Solutions sales experience is a definite plus; Be capable and Experienced selling to C-level executives and senior management at mid-market-sized accounts; Be able to lead strategic discussion with C-level leaders. Be eager to acquiring/applying industry expertise successfully in sales cycles; and continue learner. Someone who has been recognized for his/her performance and received additional responsibilities and/or promotions; Very strong communication and presentation skills; Mature Emotional Quality, be able to take stress and handle tough business case. You care about creating success for your customer and promote them into happy and reference able clients.   Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

description: Inside Sales Representative  Not even digitally ground-breaking products sell themselves. At Dell Technologies, we seek to give every one of our customers and partners a high-level, white-glove experience. This begins with our ground-breaking portfolio of products – client solutions, high-end electronics, accessories, mobility products, enterprise solutions, services and packaged software. Our Inside Sales Account Reps breathe life into our technology portfolio. They take great pride in developing lasting relationships, building great rapport and using their flawless communication skills to sell our products to customers by phone, web and email.  Join us as a Inside Sales Representative on our Inside Sales team in [Xiamen] to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.  What You’ll Achieve  As an Inside Sales Representative, you will be responsible for building business with existing customers, you will also develop relationships with new clients.  You Will Achieve targets by selling Dell's solutions via outbound calling, consultation and other influential selling techniques Maintain good business relationships with customers to conduct needs analysis, relay product information and provide technical specifications, quotations and tenders Answer inbound emails and phone calls from internal and external customers Work closely with outside sales representatives and distributors to acquire new opportunities Take the first step towards your dream career  Essential Requirements  Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Good understanding of computer technology Excellent communication, presentation and problem-solving skills Research skills, curiosity about business components Desirable Requirements Experience selling ICT solutions 1-2 years of related experience Here’s our story; now tell us yours  Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.  What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. description: Job Description Summary  Responsible for creating and winning sales opportunities for their products/solutions/services in an assigned territory, and/or in a list of named accounts individually or as part of a One GE Healthcare team. Act as the clinical/technical expert to establish and continuously develop the relationship with departmental and technical decision makers in their assigned accounts and where applicable work in conjunction with Account Executives and Managers to gain access to C-Suite decision makers.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Key responsibilities include (but are not limited to):  Support field sales team to sell the HCS equipment and business solutions to customers within Area. Actively track market dynamics including competition situations, customer needs, product evolutions and formulate analysis report to aid business forecast and planning for Modality sales team, product team& field sales team. Keep close contact with key luminaries within assigned territory, to promote latest product and clinical development from GE Healthcare, collect first hand customer feedback and needs on GE products/services and build the spokesman for GE. Prepare and co-ordinate tender response and validate tender documentation in collaboration with territory manager. Generate record and maintain customer profiles, including keeping track of key decision makers. Assist the territory manager with post sale follow up in order to ensure customer satisfaction.  Required Qualifications:  More than 5 years working experience, preferably in medical industry, either as commercial role, technical or clinical role. Excellent communication skills, both internally and externally Strong interpersonal acumen, be able to build up solid relationship with people Team working skills (including ability to harness resources to achieve goal). Good command of English both in oral and written Good business acumen, sensitivity to the dynamics in market place, with good strategic thinking capacity; Good presentation skills Bachelor and above degree, preferably in Clinical Medical background  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. The objective is to achieve targeted sales and profit objectives from a defined business territory/key customer group, in accordance with the Country/Regional Business Plan. Target new business accounts and opportunities as well as existing customers;  Actively manage the relationship with assigned distributors to ensure alignment with company objectives;  Proceed distributor/channel with the support & information needed to facilitate their effectiveness;   Maintain a high level of technical and commercial competency on relevant products, techniques and applications;  Accurately forecast sales and growth opportunities within designated territory, using sales tools and applications. description: About This Role  Description  BlackRock China Fund Management Company (FMC)  BlackRock’s purpose is to help more and more people experience financial well-being and the firm has a long history of investing in and serving investors in China. BlackRock aspires to become the leading global asset management firm operating in China and is committed to contributing to the long-term development of the local asset management industry. BlackRock China Fund Management Company, a Shanghai-based wholly-owned subsidiary of BlackRock, aims to extend its asset and risk management expertise and offer Chinese investors innovative and diversified mutual fund products and investment solutions to help transform more cash savers into long-term investors.  Role Description  BlackRock is looking to continue its expansion in Greater China with talented individuals who can truly drive the business to the next levels. We are currently looking for an experienced professional with a desire to advance his/her career to take up the role of Vice President, Sales. The position will be based in Shanghai.  The individual in this role will be responsible for developing and executing a detailed sales strategy with a focus on promoting our FMC product offerings. The primary target audience will include Banks, specific Asset Managers, Insurance Firms, and Securities Firms prioritized in partnership with distribution management, both on retailed investors and institutional investors.  Key Responsibilities Responsible for sales and marketing of BlackRock onshore funds to financial intermediaries in Mainland China, including banks, trusts, securities firms, and wealth managers covering: Business development – identifying new business opportunities Relationship management – maintaining existing client relationships, developing activity plans and sales strategies for assigned client accounts Training – preparing presentations, marketing materials, and conducting large and small scale trainings to financial intermediaries (and where relevant to end investors) Client servicing – overseeing client enquiries related to BlackRock products, operational issues, and/or other post-sale matters Partner with regional office to develop and execute annual business plans in order to achieve sales, revenue and market share targets Keep abreast of industry/competitor/market conditions, client needs, and BlackRock product information Work closely with Marketing on branding, products launches, campaigns, events and other promotion activities. Work with Legal, Compliance and Operations to process and execute distribution agreements, account openings, and ensure all materials adhere to the necessary local regulations. Coordinate client meetings, fund manager roadshows, conference calls, etc. Significant business travel is required in this position Qualifications, Knowledge And Experience At least 8 years of investment product sales experience, preferably in a high quality, multi-product investment or wealth management firm Strong relationship with major China local channels at respective provincial branch level JV FMC experience is preferred Deep knowledge of the China retail funds industry, products, and competitor landscape Ability to multi-task in fast-paced environment Experience and judgment to consistently handle complex client requirements independently Must possess outstanding written and oral communication skills, fluency in Mandarin (required) and English (preferred) Detail-oriented, client-focused, team-play, mature, confident, self-motivated, and a proven new business generator University graduate in a relevant field (Economics, Finance or Accounting) or suitable industry qualification (for example CAIA, CFA, CFP) Possess required regulatory licenses BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer—M/F/D/V.  Our Benefits  To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.  About BlackRock  At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.  This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.  For additional information on BlackRock, please visit careers.blackrock.com | www.blackrock.com/corporate | Instagram: @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock  BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.  BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.
industries: Financial Services

jobTitle: Account Manager, Mobility and Apps, Large Customer Sales
description: For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII), HTML, PDF or DOC version of your resume in English to jobs@google.com .  Important: The subject field of your email must include Account Manager, Mobility and Apps, Large Customer Sales - Beijing or Shanghai .  Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Beijing, China; Shanghai, China.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. Experience in data management and/or media buy integrations. Experience in relationship management. Ability to speak and write in English and Chinese fluently.  Preferred qualifications: Experience in data integration and media/attribution strategy. Experience in business development, customer relationship, servicing skills, and problem solving. Working knowledge of some or all of Google Media Platforms including Google Ads, Search Ads 360 (SA360), Display and Video 360 (DV360). Knowledge of Google Analytics 360 (GA360), Ads Data Hub (ADH), and Cloud for Marketing (C4M) value propositions and core capabilities.  About the jobBusinesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  Responsibilities  Work with Google’s advertisers to deliver effective platform solutions through excellent account management skills. Collaborate effectively at multiple levels by identifying key stakeholders (internal and external) and adapting communication accordingly, and staying afloat on roadmaps development and changes. Plan and deliver solution training on DV360 to customers and agencies. Deliver periodic inflight campaign updates, and post campaign report and analysis. Execute campaign setup, deliver campaign plans, providing inventory quote and proactive account management/campaign execution in close partnership with China's sales team. Report and resolve campaign execution issues, including troubleshooting and issue escalation to relevant support teams. Own Google Marketing Platform (GMP) setup, drafting, signature, and approval process for agreements. Own GMP invoicing, billing support operations, and customer troubleshooting/communications.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

description: Summary  At Apple, we work every day to create products that enrich people’s lives. Our Advertising Platforms group makes it possible for people around the world to easily access informative and imaginative content on their devices while helping publishers and developers promote and monetize their work.   Our technology and services power advertising in Apple News and Apple Ads in App Store. Our platforms are highly-performant, deployed at scale, and setting new standards for enabling effective advertising while protecting user privacy.   We are looking for a smart, motivated Sales Operations Analyst to support our growing Ad Platforms business in China. In this role, you will support the Partner Development organization in building insightful and impactful sales processes. You’ll help us establish priorities, measure success and partner with other functions with Ad Platforms and Apple.   Key Qualifications  5+ years of experience, ideally in the digital advertising industry, in a business/investment analyst, consulting, or sales operations product/program management role  Solid understanding of digital advertising landscape and KPIs for web/mobile/apps. Familiarity with search engine marketing (SEM) and/or app-install marketing preferred  High degree of proficiency in quantitative analyses, influencing with data, building business cases, and communicating data-driven insights to analytical and non-analytical audiences  Demonstrated experience with data-mining including querying data via SQL (comfort with temporary tables & multi-step queries) from relational and non-relational distributed data environments  Excellent communications, project management, and organizational skills  Strong personal code of ethics, integrity, diversity and trust.  Experience with scripting and 3rd party tools to automate and scale analyses and dashboards (R, Python, Tableau) preferred   Description  Build insights and analyses to support Partner Development team in region  Support the rollout of sales strategies including translating big picture goals into day to day accountability for the sales organization and our cross-functional partners  Drive transparency and business accountability in specific sectors (verticals) via analytics, business reviews, reporting  Partner with sales leadership on account planning/performance analysis and customer segmentation  Build and enhance internal reporting capabilities   Role Number: 200235519
industries: Consumer Electronics

description: Role/Responsibilities  Seeking an experienced and results-oriented Business Development Manager to join our fast growing corporate sales team. In this role you will have the opportunity to develop and close new sales opportunities in both green field and existing clients within corporate sector.  We are looking for someone who will remain hungry and excited to drive new businesses to the company. Proven sales expertise is a must.  Based in Beijing, China, you will be working in a team-oriented, fast-paced, entrepreneurial, roll-up your-sleeves environment where people work with passion and purpose. Everyone shares a commitment to excellence and a desire to work in a collaborative, fun atmosphere.  Key activities include identifying and qualifying prospects, making territory plan and account plan. Keep high retention rate. Generate new business through cold call of new prospect in the assigned territory/ accounts. Additionally, the role requires the assessment of client needs and providing clients with strategic guidance and product overviews.  Your compensation package will include a base salary with variable compensation based on performance against annual revenue goals and objectives.  Key Responsibilities Proactively identifying and driving new business opportunities with potential targets in the corporate sector. Maintaining a pipeline of meetings, presentations and proposals. Managing and supporting existing clients to generate and close new product and solution service sales. Understanding existing and prospective clients' projects and support needs, strategic objectives, purchasing criteria, political and other influences or constraints and decision-making processes. Presentation of solutions to existing and prospective clients throughout a consultative sales process. Attendance at industry trade shows, events and seminars (where appropriate). Developing and maintaining strong relationships with relevant industry influencers and C level people and creating broader networks within corporate sector. Working alongside the pre-sales and service delivery team and assisting with the delivery and execution of large enterprise wide solution sales. Qualifications 4-6 years experience in a relevant B2B direct sales role, with proven track record of consistently achieving strong sales targets. Experience of targeting big corporate company as sales role is highly desirable. Experience in selling data or software solutions and services within to a multi-stakeholder, long sales cycle environment. Demonstrated experience in developing and expanding strong customer relationships A strong business acumen and results driven with a drive to succeed. Proven ability to be an active listener who creates win-win outcomes for all stakeholders. Extremely disciplined execution, detail orientation, and follow through skills. Results-driven, determined, and flexible, with a strong and disciplined work ethic. Self-motivated and capable of working independently and with a team. Ability to develop, articulate and present concepts clearly to clients & colleagues. Proven skills in collaborating with colleagues and clients to develop winning, compelling value propositions for opportunities that are relatively complex and where the solution is not always obvious. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Proficient English language capabilities (business level proficiency desirable). Possess a proactive approach to problem solving, actively seeking opportunities for improvement with solutions in mind. Ability and availability for domestic and international travel. Our data, analytical solutions and insights help decision-makers identify opportunities and manage the risks of doing business with others. We believe that greater transparency, more informed decisions, and fair access to information open the door to shared progress. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody's combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com .  Entity  Moody’s Analytics provides financial intelligence and analytical tools supporting our clients’ growth, efficiency and risk management objectives. The combination of our unparalleled expertise in risk, expansive information resources, and innovative application of technology, helps today’s business leaders confidently navigate an evolving marketplace.  EEO Policy  Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.  Securities Trading Policy (STP)  Candidates for Moody's Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody’s Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.

Essential Responsibilities  •  Build and maintain relationships and sales revenues with assigned customers by learning and understanding their needs and providing solutions. •  Deliver sales results that meet or exceed metrics by driving lead generation, building sales pipelines and generating sales opportunities. •  Develop, monitor, and analyze data to improve sales performance across the department by making recommendations. •  Account management of medium to large accounts, including maintaining existing clients, prospecting and signing new clients.  Skills and Qualifications ·        No educational requirements ·        Excellent communication, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, and organizational skills ·        Good level in English communication Preferred Qualifications ·        3-5 years in sales within an international trade company setting ·        Knowledge and practice about international transfer ·        Social-network across varied industries, especially 3C and cosmetic industries ·        Mandarin or Cantonese speaker About the Company  Polymer is a mature company that highly participating in B2B business, specializing in the cross-border e-commerce business and international commodity trades. With groups of factory owners and foreign trade experts gathered, we aim at promoting high-quality and low-priced Chinese products to the global market, creating sufficient profit margins for local sellers, and achieving win-win cooperation with international enterprises. We had developed highly efficient transportation pipelines, steady and rich cooperation with Chinese local industries, not only our own OEM factories, but also a large number of other united factories. By advocating integrity management, we proceed worldwide trades with prestigious. Being a global enterprise, Polymer shows its inclusiveness, we highly value great cultural diversity, people of any cultural background and nationality are welcomed to join us.

Responsibilities  1. Rate Parity & Resort Information Management - Rate Parity * Monitor all onsite FIT channels to sell the right promotion T&C * Monitor all channel rates to ensure rate consistency  - Resort information management * Coordinate with each resort to update resort information and activities to the commercial team and B2B department, make sure all channel note update information * Support B2B team to implement JV KV, marketing material, etc…to all channel  - Sales content management * Audit and check each channel content include price, product and T&C are correct  3, JV Pricing support - Support RM to announce rolling price and dynamic price to all channels timely - Pricing strategy support and communication  4, Other Support - Promotion quota & Programming communication - Promotion consolidate with PAI together  Requirements  1.
