description: Job Description  THIS IS AN 18 MONTH FIXED TERM CONTRACT.  The Programmable Solutions Group is proud to serve more than thousands of customers with our leading technology in FPGAs, Power and structured ASIC products. In order to make sure that our Field Sales team and FAEs can spend as much time as possible with the customers, the Sales Operations Specialist team is here to make sure that the machinery in the background is working smoothly. We are the first point of contact and we know the ins and outs for almost any question, and if we don't know it, we find it out or get hold of the right person. We are working closely with teams across the globe who support us in our daily endeavours. Manages the sales operation process, performs forecasting, budgeting, planning, quoting, and analysis activities for sales operations. Acts as the communication conduit between the Customer, Sales, Business Unit, and the Factory to optimize revenue and achieve mutual objectives. Manages the customer's supply chain requirements, product demand and the company's supply strategies. Evaluates pricing structures to ensure fit with company objectives. Approves and executes pricing exceptions. Develops, implements and manages the underlying business processes running the sales operations functions. Determines CRM, other sales enablement, and sales operations system requirements to support the business processes, working with IT. Manages sales data operations and view of performance to critical business indicators. Strong ability on systematizing reports and business analysis, he/she is able to manage the data with multiple criteria, provide a clear picture of business trend and its impact. Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint Ability to regularly perform independent analysis, development, and implementation of solution to complex problems in business management and operations. Ability to Work both regionally and globally, flexibility in working hours to support other time zone This Job Might Be For You If  You enjoy solving problems. Taking on a challenge is something you like and finding a creative solution is your speciality. Finding the answer and not giving up is a strength of yours.  You like helping people. You go above and beyond and you not only do what you're asked to do, you look one step ahead and do that little extra - with a smile.  You pay attention to details. When you do something you do it thoroughly and well. You're organized and well prepared. Being able to prioritize and re-prioritize during the day is not a problem.  You communicate clearly. English is the corporate language and you can both speak and write it fluently. Listening to understand is also a given, and you ask clarifying questions to make sure.  You are motivated and driven. Working independently and taking a task and work on it from start to finish, involving the people who can help you when needed. If you see something that can be improved, you raise your voice and present your proposal.  You like working in a team and you are comfortable sharing both success and mistakes, as you learn from both. You support your team during holidays and leaves and you can also rely on your peers when you need their help.  Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or other relevant third level qualification Supply chain, program management, order management, planning or related experience in a semiconductor or high-tech company. Hands on experience with order management systems like SAP, Salesforce Experience with MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, MS Office A typical day as a Sales Operations Specialist might look like this: Work in Salesforce with the newly submitted Design Registrations from our distributors and ensure that criteria's and guidelines are met before approval. Meet with your Sales Representative with the Distributor FAE team to review the current Design Pipeline and help move the designs forward Review the Quote requests in Siebel that our distributors have submitted and make sure that all details are in place before assigning it to our Business Management team for approval Prepare for and drive an important call with a customer to work on a critical delivery situation that has been escalated to you together with our Customer Operations team. Our distributor Asset team is also involved and you are orchestrating this on behalf of Intel. Monitor and ensure that the Opportunity Pipeline Health criteria's are met and take necessary actions, for example alert the Sales team about some opportunities that are approaching the decision date soon. Arrange a sample order for a customer who need parts urgently for a prototype build Support your Sales Representative with necessary information for forecasting purposes, you find the information easily in Power Bi or BOBJ. Track and trace a piece of business that was designed by the Sales Team in Finland and that has started to ship in Malaysia, in order to bring back the revenue to the region. Answer emails from your distributor partners related to leadtime questions, access to our portal and pricing queries. Help a customer to renew a license for software and consult our team in Penang if there are questions you cannot answer Take the advanced Excel training via the O'Reilly platform that your peer recommended. Inside this Business Group  The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: Inspired by kids and imaginative play, ZURU is one of the fastest growing toy companies in the world that is known for it's agility, creativity and new-age manufacturing techniques. Zuru also operates a consumer business, Zuru Edge, delivering disruptive brands in big, stodgy consumer goods categories We are growing rapidly with launch of more successful brand planned ahead in the year and we are inviting analytical, self driven individuals for our Sales Operations team.  The Sales Analyst would be responsible for sales analysis, forecasting, internal and external collaboration with planners and analysts, reporting and supporting sales presentations. As Sales Analyst, you will oversee optimising company item assortment and in stock levels, reporting and coordinating with company supply chain on FMCG shipment requirements and working with FMCG Sales Managers to ensure a successful flow of orders and product.  Job Duties & Responsibilities Working in FMCG environment: ·      Create ladder plans utilizing statistical models, sales projections, POS data, order flows, event calendars, and other market intelligence collected from various business sources including distribution centers to manage and monitor accounts. ·      Pull reports and data to manage each sku and the supply to each store. ·      Recommend and write orders to move product through the supply chain. ·      Analyze store level POS data to identify potential out-of-stock issues ·      Monitor and report on key replenishment metrics, forecast accuracy, replenishment, inventory, and service as indicated by specified retailers. ·      Investigate stocking, delivery, and product activity issues. ·      Manage transfer requirements by location, find root causes and implement solutions. ·      Effectively analyze and execute Inventory Policy settings to support Seasonal Activity ·      Order Management - maintain a high level of accuracy on orders, pricing, execution of allocations, comparison of forecast to trends ·      Analyze corporate, DC, and store level forecasts on continued basis to identify risk and opportunities ·      Compile reports and insights from available third party and retailer data on own brand v competitor brand activities and sales performance including but not limited to promotional tactics, uplift, market share, and present this to sales managers with key recommendations. ·      Assist with scorecard analysis for both internal and external meetings. ·      Assist with key meeting prep.  Desired Skills & Attributes ·      Bachelor’s degree in finance, Mathematics, Business, or related field ·      Strong background and experience with data mining and statistical analysis ·      Minimum 1 year experience as a business analyst or similar role for a FMCG company, with responsibility for analyzing POS-based data and formulating insights and recommendations for retailer. ·      Highly effective at developing presentation materials that are clear, concise, and compelling. ·      Excellent command of Microsoft Office. Very proficient in excel
jobFunction: Supply Chain, Analyst, and Project Management

description: Our Sales Operations team is at the heart of developing sales processes and procedures for administering, fulfilling and communicating both online and offline orders. A bridge between sales and other operational functions, we use our peerless expertise to evaluate and implement improvements to sales programs and processes – from planning and prioritization to pricing and margin strategies, sales automation, reporting and more. Put simply, we make sure the process of getting our ground-breaking products and services to customers as simple and seamless as possible.  Join us as a Sales Operations Specialist on our Sales Operations team in [Xiamen] to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.  What You’ll Achieve  As a Sales Operations Specialist, you will support the Greater China market with responsibilities for processing partner deal registration requests and rendering a decision to approve or deny the requests within established timeframe / Service Level Agreement. Activities include researching account ownership, searching pipeline / forecast for duplicate deals, and contacting partner, indirect team or direct account team, as needed to reach an approval / denial decision.  You Will Extensive coordination of communications with sales force and cross-functional organizations Providing operational support to maximize sales force productivity and improve Partner / Customer Experience. Providing of solutions when facing issues and inconsistencies Providing regular feedback & report on activities to manager Contact with team leaders and customer account managers on a daily basis, to provide support, assistance and guidance in the process of deal registration. Interaction with Dell internal customers for follow-up on escalated issues to provide resolution or to continue issue resolution. Contact with peers and direct manager to discuss deals processing issues that affect group Take the first step towards your dream career  Essential Requirements  Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: 1+ year of work experience Strong analytical skills, Excellent attention to detail Verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills,-English &Mandarin languages - advanced Able to manage multi-tasking and multiple priorities MS Excel, MS SharePoint, MS Outlook and familiar with Sales Force (SFDC) application Desirable Requirements Experience working with data and presentation skills are a plus Here’s our story; now tell us yours  Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.  What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.  We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.  You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.  Application closing date: 31 Oct. 2021  Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here. description: Senior Sales Manager, North China  Location: Flexible (Beijing Preferred)   Vantiq is a hot Silicon Valley startup that delivers a software platform to quickly develop and deploy the next generation of applications, applications that manages an ecosystem that consists of real-time devices (IOT, smartphones, tablets,…), legacy applications (Oracle, SAP, Salesforce, etc..), real-time social media feeds, etc... These applications can handle hundreds of thousands of events per second, provides man-machine collaboration, are distributed to any combination of cloud, edge and on-premise and are highly scalable.  Vantiq is looking for an extraordinary sales executive who loves joining a hot early stage software startup company and build the business in the region. The ideal candidate has the vision and the track record in building a significant software business in the region, especially in the industries of Energy, State Owned Enterprise (SOE), Local State Subsidized Campus and other public sectors. This position will report to the VP of Sales of Greater China.      The ideal candidate should be comfortable in having relationships with customers and partners at all levels and very important, proven experience in successfully building a partner ecosystem of System Integrators, Resellers and OEMs in a major technology company throughout the region.  Some of the things you’ll be doing include…  Develop business strategy, grow sales and serve customers. Work closely with the VP of Sales of Greater China. Meet & exceed quarterly sales targets. Provide weekly reporting of pipeline and forecast. Define and manage the strategic plan for the growth in the region. You’ll strategize and execute on plans for channel programs, marketing programs and product feedback.  Establish strong channel partners in the region. o  Overview the recruitment and management of local, regional and global partners based in the region. o  Aggressively work to maximize partner total sales potential through best practices, training and support. o  Excellent communication with management, partners, customers and support staff. o  Be responsible for the management and development the partners, providing them with direction, motivation and leadership. o  Create strategic relationships with senior decision makers within our key partners. Provide feedback and coordination to HQ and local team from the region. Provide input, direction and guidance to other staff in the region including Pre-Sales and Marketing. Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products. Participate in sales meetings, product seminars and trade shows as appropriate. Conduct contract negotiations. Travel flexibility --- Travel to partner or customer locations to meet partners and support sales efforts.  Who you are…  Experienced.  Significant direct leadership and strategic partnership experience. You have a solid career history and a proven track record of driving success through partners. Leader. Exceptional management, interpersonal, communication and presentation skills. People want to work with you and for you. Entrepreneurial. You are a creative and strategic thinker. Management Experience. Extensive management skills in software sales including strategic selling. Startup attitude. You have a positive attitude and will “roll up your sleeve” and do what it takes. Energy and Enthusiasm.  You believe in what we’re doing and won’t stop at anything to deliver on your goals. Excellent Communication skills - whether that be to the receptionist or the CEO, your communication style is professional at all times - you know what to say, and how to say it. Problem Solver.  You love tackling the most difficult of challenges and know how to get to the best solution. Executive presence and credibility. Performer.  Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding assigned goals and targets. Go-Getter. You thrive in a fast-paced, high growth, rapidly changing environment. Conviction and Commitment. Able to work independently and remotely from other members of your team and corporate. Educated. Bachelor's degree in related field, or equivalent experience. Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products. Participate in team-building and company-growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and customer care.  About VANTIQ:  VANTIQ’s goal is to provide the best technology platform for enterprises to digitize their business while keeping humans in charge.  The VANTIQ application platform-as-a-service enables users to develop, deploy and run real-time enterprise applications driven by data streams from IoT, connected products, social, enterprise systems of record and people. All applications created with VANTIQ are event-driven, allowing businesses to respond in real-time to any business event.

description: About The Role Key account (AbGenius) team focus on deep service and support KOLs to drive key accounts revenue that deliver Abcam’s strategic goals and objectives. These efforts will utilize our broad capabilities to position Abcam as the partner of cutting-edge scientists in Academic/bio-industry/hospital market. Working across the multi-channels, we aim to position the full scope of Abcam’s innovative technology platforms and expertise to serve scientists and capture downstream revenue opportunities. Most importantly, we are working hand-in-hand with these scientists to achieve their research better, to get their discoveries beyond research faster. Roles & Responsibilities Establish account plans, objectives and forecasts for each key account and update plans monthly. Serves as a consultant to the target accounts, tracking the shopping list of Accounts and identification of key influencer, decision maker and end user Work with channel manager and distributor sales team to drive the technical aspects of pre-sales and post-sales activities Leverage available resources to meet customer needs and work effectively with cross-functional team of supplier and internal resources Introduce Abcam’s cutting-edge product portfolio based on PI’s latest research/next step Develop strong relationships at the Key accounts to build a strong partnership for expanding the business opportunities. Keep abreast on market and customer research to provide knowledge about market and industry to internal and external customers Inform on product tactics, providing customer insights to the marketing/portfolio team. About You Master’s above Degree, Ph.D preferred, majors in molecular biology or biotechnology, Proven experience (1-3 years) in sales skills and key account management in life science industry. Solid knowledge of the cutting-edge in life science research/bioindustry is preferred. Has very strong convincing and influencing skills. Dynamic personality, team player with open communication style. Great customer facing skills. If this sounds like you and you’d like to be a part of a fast-paced, growing business with the vision to become the most influential company and best-loved brand in life sciences, please apply now!  Pay & Benefits  In addition to competitive salaries, we offer an attractive and flexible benefits package, a culture focused on well-being and opportunities for growth and development, and a highly flexible working environment.  About Us  An idea conceived in a University of Cambridge laboratory in 1998, Abcam plc (www.abcamplc.com) began life as an innovative and entrepreneurial start-up, spearheaded by like-minded individuals who shared a common purpose of providing the scientific community with quality antibody reagents, as well as trustworthy and up-to-date information about their uses and limitations. Abcam has now grown to become a leading supplier of protein research tools to life scientists, whilst always maintaining the core collaborative values assumed at its inception.  Abcam now supports life science researchers in their quest to understand the cause of disease and ultimately offer improvements to diagnoses and treatments. To achieve this outcome, the company both develops and manufactures its own products in specialist facilities across the globe, and sources from over 400 partners, offering scientists the newest, most innovative and highest quality research tools available globally, regardless of source. With a customer base of research scientists who require high performance products with detailed technical specifications, 64% of global researchers use Abcam products.  Inclusion & Diversity  Abcam is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes all employment decisions without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Sealed Air generated $4.9 billion in sales in 2020 and has approximately 16,500 employees who serve customers in 115 countries. To learn more, visit www.sealedair.com. description: If you’re an enterprise IT sales superstar, this position offers a prime opportunity to take the next step in your career. The role of Sales Director offers you a strong platform to create demand for the data center environment, as well as sell polished enterprise solutions for the largest wholesale data center provider in the world. The opportunities to succeed are tremendous, and as company continues to grow, we'll be looking for proven sales players to move up.  The Requirements  To be a strong fit for this opportunity you should have: • A minimum of 10 years of experience selling enterprise IT solutions • Proven ability to close sales with C-level executives • Ability to understand enterprise data center needs, define requirements and customize data center solutions for a variety of organizations • A large Rolodex of customers in the position’s region • Excellent communication and negotiation skills • Understanding of a real estate-focused organization • A deep understanding to leverage the goals of the sales team • A bachelor’s degree or at least 6 years of related experience   The Role  In this role you will work closely with a team of sales directors, as well as supporting sales engineers. You’ll be in charge of your assigned territory, making cold calls to our prime candidates in the Web-based, corporate and service provider markets.  You will work from a combination of home and our offices. Additionally, you may also travel occasionally with customers to tour company’s data center locations throughout the U.S., Europe and Asia.  In sales, no day is ever the same; however, with each sales call, you’ll be expected to strategically evaluate a potential customer’s data center requirements and clearly articulate company’s value propositions and competitive advantage.  With aggressive sales goals, you'll need to have some serious new-business development chops, and know how to break through the gatekeepers to penetrate the appropriat

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

description: Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.  At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.  In this role, as a Service Sales Specialist you will involve in presenting and selling robotics services to current client’s service portfolio to ABB customers for Robotics & Discrete Automation Business Area in Shanghai, Hangzhou, China, helping to drive sales volumes and margins across the service product portfolio and regularly updating the database with changes made on-site.  Reporting to the Service Sales Manager, you will play a crucial role in implementing the service sales strategy, with a focus on penetrating installed base and promoting various upgrade, retrofit and value-added solutions.  Your responsibilities Utilizing the database to grasp the existing installed base, and identifying and developing sales opportunities Establishing long-term customer relationships, reacting immediately to issues, and demonstrating in-depth technical knowledge of products and solutions Communicating contract details in accordance with ABB offerings and strategy, and managing associated administrative sales processes Preparing and reviewing sales plans and proposing recovery actions when needed Actively promoting ABB’s service products and solutions in marketing activities (e.g., trade fairs and customer meetings) while monitoring trends to develop effective marketing activities Your background 3+ years of work experience in technical sales, (sales experience in automotive industrial products is preferred) Having computer skills, including Office, PPT etc. A bachelor’s degree with major in engineering A collaborative, solution-focused approach, and strong written and spoken communication skills in English Ability to develop and manage customer relationships and withstand high pressure, sales need to be local An individual who is proactive, aggressive, and initiative, customer oriented and able to travel in the province  Benefits Life insurance Disability insurance Medical insurance Sick pay Meal allowance More about us  ABB Robotics & Discrete Automation is a pioneer in robotics, machine automation and digital services, providing innovative solutions for a diverse range of industries, from automotive to electronics to logistics. As one of the world’s leading robotics and machine automation suppliers, we have shipped over 500,000 robot solutions. We help our customers of all sizes to increase productivity, flexibility, and simplicity and to improve output quality. We support their transition towards the connected and collaborative factory of the future. ABB Robotics & Discrete Automation employs more than 11,000 people at over 100 locations in more than 53 countries.  We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website.   80010417

description: Wealth and Personal Banking (WPB)  Wealth and Personal Banking is our new global business combining Retail Banking and Wealth Management; and Global Private Banking, to become a global wealth managers with USD1.4 trillion in assets. Our dedicated colleagues serve millions of customers worldwide across the entire spectrum of private wealth, ranging from personal banking individuals and families, through to business owners, investors and ultra-high-net-worth individuals. We provide products and services such as bank accounts, credit cards, personal loans and mortgages, as well as asset management, insurance, wealth management and private banking, that best suit our customers’ needs.  We are currently seeking an experienced professional to join our team.  In this role, you will: To handle all inferior HSBC Premier (HP) accounts and zero-balance HP accounts follow up work; To chase deposit from all Home Mortgage Loan (HML) customers with monthly average balance below the threshold for HML preferential interest rate; To answer all incoming HP phone calls if Premier Relationship Officer (PRO) is occupied and to be responsible for all messages HP customer leave in PRO's voice mail; To make sure HP gift redemption mechanics works smoothly; To proactively identify sales opportunities, cross-sell bank products and services most beneficial to customers, and individually complete sales process if all PROs are occupied; To back up PRO who is on leave or during lunchtime. Deliver fair outcomes for our customers and ensure own conduct maintains the orderly and transparent operation of financial markets.  To be successful in the role, you should meet the following requirements: Bachelor degree or above(recognized by the state); With 1-2 years' working experience, sales or customer service experience is preferred; Good communication and selling skills; Good understanding of Retail Banking and Wealth Management products and services; Good spoken and written English ; Well organized; With nice personality. You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC.  www.hsbc.com.cn/careers  HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within and inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website. description: 销售客户经理  从开发全新客户到在现有客户基础上扩大客户群，我们的直接销售团队将机会转变为每一天的行动。无论关注点放在某一地理区域、产品线、行业、渠道还是细分市场，他们的目标始终如一，即与组织的终用户建立关系，并挖掘有意义的销售。他们直接将我们开创性的产品解决方案组合送到满意客户的面前。  欢迎加入我们的直销团队，成为郑州的销售客户经理，您将与业界顶尖的人员一同共事并产生深远的社会影响。  行业客户经理将利用深厚的客户关系与渠道资源，带领团队帮助客户实现IT数据化转型：  关键职责： 助力区域或行业客户的数字化转型，完成公司销售目标 销售戴尔科技集团的全线产品，为客户提供端到端解决方案：包括桌面电脑，工作站，服务器、存储、网络、虚拟化、服务等 管理区域/客户，包括客户规划、销售预测、利用跨职能部门的资源和与虚拟团队合作 善于利用和整合资源，建立生态系统，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 基本要求： 有丰富的IT产品解决方案销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 5年以上相关工作经验，本科及以上学历或者同等经验 期望的要求： 有数据中心解决方案销售经验优先 戴尔科技集团旗下拥有多家企业，面向客户提供各种创新技术和服务产品组合，旨在助力组织和个人构建数字化未来并实现工作、生活和娱乐方式转型。客户至上、互利共赢、积极创新、追求成效、诚信经营是我们的准则。加入我们独具魅力的大家庭，体验崇尚多元化和包容性的企业文化，享受颇具竞争力的薪酬、奖励方案、优厚福利以及宝贵的学习和发展机会，轻松拓展职业生涯。了解我们如何弥合多元化差距。  截止日期：2021年 12月31日  戴尔秉持所有员工工作机会平等的原则，致力于为员工提供⼀个无歧视、无骚扰的工作环境。戴尔的所有雇用决策基于业务需求、工作要求以及资历，与⺠族、肤色、宗教或信仰、国籍、出身或种族、性别（包括怀孕）、年龄、身体、精神或知觉障碍、HIV状况、性取向、性别认同和/或表达、婚姻、民事结合或同居伴侣关系状况、过去或现在的兵役、家族病史或遗传信息、家庭或⽗⺟状况或任何其他受我们运营地点的法律法规保护的状况无关。戴尔决不容忍基于任何上述特征的歧视或骚扰。单击此处，了解有关戴尔多元化和包容性文化的详细信息。  Job Function: Outside Sales
industries: Computer Hardware, Computer Software, and Information Technology and Services

description: Job Description  准备好在 Mondelēz International 行动致成了吗？  与我们共同完成引领零食未来的使命。充满自豪。  您将领导现场销售代表组，确保销售战略的执行和年度关键绩效指标及特定区域目标的达成。您将与跨职能通知密切合作，从而依据关键绩效指标进行激活和汇报。  岗位职责  您将： 管理、培训并激励团队，并与销售能力组密切合作，以确保进行团队培训。 创建并管理年度业务部门计划，以实现商定的渠道收入关键绩效指标及目标，并在必要时进行汇报。 管理客户业务致胜关系，以成就所在品类的“行业最佳”操作。 与重要利益相关者紧密合作，包括客户团队、品类、激活团队、销售能力及客户财务，以实现所在领域的最佳收益。 充分理解品类及洞察知识，指导团队使用品类工具与客户交流并对其产生影响，由此制定出实现品类发展和年度计划的知情决策。  任职要求  不断前进、加速职业生涯的愿望，以及以下经验及知识技能： 了解 Mondelēz International 客户市场及市场渠道 销售经历 强大的组织及分析技能 卓越的沟通和交流技能 扎实的销售及谈判流程知识 有韧性且注重细节  N  No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary We’ve been bringing our products to Greater China for over 35 years, making, marketing and selling our mouth-watering, well-loved local and global brands such as Oreo, LU and Chips Ahoy! biscuits, Pacific wafers, Stride gumand Milka chocolate. Headquartered in Shanghai, our 4,000 employees proudly work in sales offices and in our Research & Development Technical Centre in Suzhou. We are also proud to be awarded China’s 2020 Top Employer certification.  Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Job Type RegularField SalesSales
industries: Food Production, Food & Beverages, and Consumer Goods

description: Senior Sales Operations Advisor  Our Sales Operations team is at the heart of developing sales processes and procedures for administering, fulfilling and communicating both online and offline orders. A bridge between sales and other operational functions, we use our peerless expertise to evaluate and implement improvements to sales programs and processes – from planning and prioritization to pricing and margin strategies, sales automation, reporting and more. Put simply, we make sure the process of getting our ground-breaking products and services to customers as simple and seamless as possible.  Join us as a Senior Advisor on our Sales Operations team in Xiamen to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.  What You’ll Achieve  As a Senior Sales Operations Advisor, you will enable clients to maximize returns on IT investments, drive efficiencies and reduce costs. You will play a meaningful role in meeting customers’ needs, as well as crafting and maintaining a global portal for customer accounts. You will build positive relationships, ensuring an outstanding experience for both our customers and our sales teams.  You Will Develop, design, and monitor operational sales tools, tasks and programs Coordinate communications and information dissemination with the sales force and cross-functional organizations within Dell Technologies Lead process improvement programs Liaise between the customer and the sales organization Take the first step towards your dream career  Essential Requirements  Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: 8 to 12 years of related experience Ability to analyze information and draw accurate conclusions Strong project management skills A solid understanding of industry trends A good understanding of key sales and management reporting tools Desirable Requirements Bachelor’s degree Experience working with sales and external customers or in support of different business units and geographies Here’s our story; now tell us yours  Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.  What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.  We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.  You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.  Application closing date: 2021, 12,30  Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.  Job Id: R130652Job Function: Sales Operations

description: Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.  At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.  As a Digital Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for sales of products/systems/services within a designated market in accordance with strategy. Build long term customer relationships and manage resolution to specific customer needs and issues, for Electrification Business Area in Xiamen, China.  Reporting to the Sales Manager, you will identify and develop sales opportunities, especially for digital solution.  Your responsibilities Selling products/systems/services to customers, achieving business targets for assigned business area /product groups Establishing and maintaining effective customer relationships to understand customer needs, promoting customer understanding of full product/systems/ services offering, and aligning to provide a solution. Ensuring a positive customer experience Identifying and driving the development of new market opportunities in the designated market Identifying digital sales opportunities and promoting digital solutions to customers Managing administrative procedures in sales processes, and supporting collection and project management activities when needed Your background 3 years sales experience in related industries, strong sales competency with digital capability Good experience and knowledge of digitalization (automation) project Strong learning ability, customer orientation, strong sense of responsibility and personal integrity A bachelor or master’s degree, major in science or engineering (electrical automation major is preferred) Must be result driven and have strong interpersonal and communication skills Must be good at teamwork  Benefits Life insurance Disability insurance Sick pay Medical insurance Meal allowance More about us  ABB’s Electrification Global Markets organization is responsible for the go-to-market strategy and generating profitable growth for the Electrification Business Area. Our 10,000 strong commercial team represents the portfolio of all Electrification Business Area Divisions in over 100 countries. Our unmatched domain expertise across key industry verticals and channels combined with our truly global footprint makes us able to deliver extraordinary business results, supporting our customers with solutions which address their current needs, whilst considering the future emerging trends such as Urbanization, Digitalization and Shift to Electricity and Sustainable Energy.  We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website.   80036228
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing

description: What You Will Do 负责轻型商用中央空调设备的销售与品牌推广，执行公司市场销售策略，达成销售目标； 执行公司市场销售策略，达成销售目标； 建立和拓宽销售渠道，发展经销网络，提供良好的客户服务，建立并维护良好的客户关系 与维修部门密切配合，确保客户获得高质量的售后服务； 对经销商进行产品培训，协助经销商达成项目销售； 公司安排的其他工作。 What We Want 暖通、空调、制冷或其他相关工程类专业专科或以上学历； 三年以上空调冷冻或电机机械类产品销售工作经验； 优秀的人际沟通能力，团队协调合作能力和分析判断能力； 良好的英语阅读能力； 5、能够独立工作，擅长团队合作，能承受一定工作压力。  Job  Sales & Marketing  Primary Location  China-33-Hangzhou  Organization  Bldg Technologies & Solutions

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. description: Sales Manager  销售经理 中国区  Would you like to build upon your career in digital sales with the market leader; one of the fastest growing companies in online marketing and in an international environment?  有意愿在数字销售领域与市场领导者共同发展吗?供职于网络营销和国际环境中发展最快的公 司?  Outbrain is seeking a highly motivated, entrepreneurial sales manager with focus on the large agency groups to join their commercial team in the Netherlands, based in central Amsterdam.  Outbrain 正在寻找一个富有上进心的大客户销售经理，主要职责是与大型代理集团进行合作并 寻找更多商业机会。  The successful candidate will be responsible for driving direct revenue by leveraging the industry’s leading content and native discovery solution with a strong focus on new business for agencies and brands– you are a hunter! You will be structurally working with the agencies as well as their brand teams, building a revenue pipeline and turning prospects into partners.   基于行业领先的原生内容发现解决方案，合格的候选人将会专注于为代理商和品牌提供新业 务，从而推动直接收入——如同一个猎人!你将与代理机构及品牌团队直接合作，拓展收入渠 道，将潜在客户转变为合作伙伴。  Winning factors - we are looking for evidence of:  • 2-4 years digital sales experience   • Fluency in English  • Proven track record in sales  • You are a hunter and thrive to exceed targets • Clear and concise communication skills and presentation style, for both internal and external stakeholders  • A natural people-person with an existing brands client network and proven examples of establishing, growing and leveraging key relationships  • A curious and self-starting nature  • Strategic planning ability and the drive to achieve and stretch targets  • A willingness to “get stuck in” and be proactive  • A team player who thrives on strong collaboration  • Organised - there is a lot to do!      • Understanding and knowledge of the native, ad-tech, performance marketing and   programmatic landscape        成功要素-您需要具备  • 2-4 年数字销售经验  • 流利的英语  • 有良好的销售记录  • 如同猎手，可以成功地超越目标  • 对内对外都有清晰到位的沟通能力和演示能力  • 拥有品牌客户网络、并可以发展和利用关系网络的成熟经理人  • 好奇心和自我驱动的天性  • 具有战略规划能力和实现目标的动力  • 愿意“投入”，积极主动  • 善于团队合作的人  • 有组织性——有很多事情要做!  • 理解和了解原生广告技术，绩效营销和程序化广告  Location: Beijing, Guangzhou or Shenzhen are preferred.   工作地点：北京，广州或深圳优先考虑

description: Not even digitally ground-breaking products sell themselves. At Dell Technologies, we seek to give every one of our customers and partners a high-level, white-glove experience. This begins with our ground-breaking portfolio of products – client solutions, high-end electronics, accessories, mobility products, enterprise solutions, services and packaged software. Our Inside Sales Account Reps breathe life into our technology portfolio. They take great pride in developing lasting relationships, building great rapport and using their flawless communication skills to sell our products to customers by phone, web and email.  Join us as a Inside Sales Representative on our Inside Sales team in [Xiamen] to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.  What You’ll Achieve  As an Inside Sales Representative, you will be responsible for building business with existing customers, you will also develop relationships with new clients.  You Will 需优化和调整机器人的话术设置和逻辑（商品上新、活动内容话术上新及优化） 京小智关联销售商品添加及实时更新小智知识库 每日查看京小智的聊天记录，并对其进行质检和分析，提取、总结用户询问的问题 京小智相关的日报、周报、月报，需要对数据进行解读和分析并作出优化方案（买家咨询热点的分析、检查数据分析，汇总） Take the first step towards your dream career  Essential Requirements  Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: 统招本科及以上学历，熟悉京东平台规则，有AI训练师初级证书者优先。 善于沟通，有良好的团队合作精神，能够协助统筹京小智运营。 有良好的逻辑思维能力，能够通过数据，提炼出优化的方法论。 公平公正，注重细节，有良好的服务意识，执行力好，能够承受工作压力和挑战，适应临时加班。 具有较强的沟通能力，能够独立统筹，并推动工作进展，具有良好的学习能力和钻研精神，乐于研究。 Desirable Requirements 良好的英文书面及口语能力，英语六级及以上优先录用。 Here’s our story; now tell us yours  Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.  What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.  We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. description: 计划未来3-5年上市 全盘管理销售团队  About Our Client  一家集模具、检具设计制造、精密冲压、自动化非标设备及自动点焊设备设计制造、汽车微动开关全自动组装、Pin针连接件的独特设计和系列加工等销售服务为一体的综合性制造企业。 公司拥有长期从事有色金属与黑色金属弹性材料的优秀技术研发团队，其中技术及管理人员60多人，注册资金人民币2000万元. 公司在溧阳中关村已投资100亩厂房，和宁德时代展开合作研发新产品并进行配套，公司未来前景远大. 公司始终立足于高起点、着眼于高端市场，公司进口的一批先进的生产设备，已逐渐从人工作业往半自动化再向全自动化作业的转型和升级。同时以满足客户期望为企业宗旨, 规范与提升企业的品质管理，公司建立了完善的软件管理系统和质量管理体系, 并通过了IATF16949质量体系认证。 我司拥有高性能检测装置等先进设备，按照客户的要求制作高标准、高质量的产品，尤其是对于量大的零部件采用连续冲压、带料电镀、自动焊接、自动铆接等先进工艺，能为客户提供稳定的、大批量生产的电子零部件是本公司的特色。具有发明专利的电子控制模块弹性PIN针，被称为第三代弹性PIN针，可以根据客户的要求定制，该PIN针广泛应用于汽车电子、航空等行业。  Job Description  负责销售团队的管理 负责公司高速发展阶段的团队搭建 主管商务客户开发拓须事务以及落地实施 指导、培养、高水平的团队，发现和探索汽车行业的新机会，提出解决问题的新技术和方法  The Successful Applicant  汽车零配件行业商务背景，曾在本土或合资企业带销售团队经验 形象气质佳，有良好生活习惯（不抽烟） 工科背景，技术型销售（技术转销售），能看懂图纸，有产品设计经验加分 优秀的教育背景，复旦、交大、北大、清华、同济等985, 211院校优先  What's On Offer  丰厚的公司股份（预计未来3-5年创业板上市)  Contact: Star Lu  Quote job ref: 4216885

The incumbent will work within the framework of growing the client base, assisting the sales team in new business generation for Compliance domain related business, and provide expert knowledge on MA products. Candidate will start to take on a team lead role with the possibility to be a Sales Manager and lead the Sales team across China and Hong Kong. Reporting to Senior Director, Head of APAC KYC Sales based in Singapore Strong prospecting and new business development experience Meet established revenue targets, while creating new and enhanced customer relationships to ensure satisfaction Manage full lifecycle sales process which includes, identifying and initiating new sales opportunities by prospecting new clients and leveraging off existing client relationships, sales presentations and contract negotiations Generate new revenue from research, product and service solutions and defending & growing existing revenue streams Represent company at industry and company sponsored events, as required Respond to RFIs and RFPs Demonstrate the superiority and value of our solutions to potential and existing clients Partner with the wider sales team to build the sales pipeline and promote Moody’s Analytics solutions Provide guidance and leadership to existing members of the KYC sales team Assist the Head of APAC KYC Sales with sales strategy development and implementation Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required Proven track record of sales production and quota attainment, preferably within the financial services sector Previous experience in selling data solutions is preferred Creative problem-solving skills and ability to diagnose issues and develop solution At least 8 years’ experience in consultative selling with ability to influence key decision makers Ability to interact with Senior level stakeholders Excellent presentation and negotiation skills Strong knowledge of Fincrime related products Travel required within China LOB/Cost Center  Sales  Job Req ID  22161BR  Entity  Moody's Analytics (MA)  Line of Business  Know Your Customer OU (KYC OU)  Regular/Temporary  Regular  City  Shanghai  Job Category  Sales & Marketing  Job Sub Category  Sales  Experience Level  Experienced Hire  Working at Moody's  Moody's (NYSE: MCO) is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions. Our data, analytical solutions and insights help decision-makers identify opportunities and manage the risks of doing business with others. We believe that greater transparency, more informed decisions, and fair access to information open the door to shared progress. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody's combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com .  Entity  Moody’s Analytics provides financial intelligence and analytical tools supporting our clients’ growth, efficiency and risk management objectives. The combination of our unparalleled expertise in risk, expansive information resources, and innovative application of technology, helps today’s business leaders confidently navigate an evolving marketplace. description: Nayax is looking for Sales Lead who will drive retention and growth among our most valuable customers by understanding their business needs and helping them succeed. As a Sales Lead, you will be responsible for assisting and consulting Nayax’s customers about our new or existing products and will make sure that all our customer’s needs are being addressed.  We are looking for candidates who can build a solid relationship with a genuine passion for the success of their customers, as well as a proactive problem solver with impressive communication and presentation skills.  As a Sales Lead You Will Mainly face customer pool of Chinese automatic machines manufacturers for their export market Generate and follow up leads, opportunities until order closure Account management Inside sales Be able to sell the company’s products and solutions during longer sales cycles Dealing with several stake holders in a customer’s company: sales, purchase, management, etc. Related sales admin works Work as a team in organizing events and trade shows Other tasks assigned by the sales manager Requirements  The ideal candidate will have: Chinese language is a must; English communication skills are required; 4 years related work experience; A bachelor’s degree in business related major; Work proactively and a team player; Good computer skills; Experience in delivering customer-focused solutions based on customer needs. Excellent verbal and written communications skills. Driven, self-motivated, enthusiastic and with a bias for action. Business background preferable from sales or account management Good communication skills, presentation skills and ability to negotiate with several stake holders; Strong technical skills with the ability and desire to guide and assist customers through technical processes Advantages Knowledge in Networking Protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, SSL) Knowledge in CRM, Salesforce, or BI tools; Previous experience in payment industry; Who We Are  Nayax is a global Fin-tech company and is the leading provider for cashless payment solutions for devices such as vending machines, self-check-out stations, electric vehicle chargers and more.  Nayax develops both hardware and software products, telemetry, remote management, BI solutions, and mobile apps. Nayax devices can be found all over the world, with branches in 9 countries, and 40 distributing partners. Our devices serve consumers in 55 countries and accept 26 currencies.  Join us in our fast paced, cutting-edge environment. We love friendly, creative, and fun people.  Nayax is constantly growing, and we are always on the lookout for enthusiastic, innovative and eager individuals to join us in our growth!
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Machinery, and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

description: Job Description Summary Customer facing staff responsible for winning business Operates with some autonomy but are typically subject to standard sales practices and procedures. The role is subject to regular review of sales results. Some judgment may be required but this is typically with guidance. May be responsible for medium-sized sales territories.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  角色与职责  向指定客户销售时，新增客户通常很少，并且通常需要经过审查。包括单个业务组/P&L 中的关键客户 对销售区域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群有深入的了解。利用先前的经验和获得的商业专业知识来执行政策/策略。 深入理解关键业务驱动力；用这种理解来完成自己的工作。深入了解自己团队的工作如何与其他团队融合并为该领域做出贡献。 大多数决策都在规定的框架内，但是对于项目、产品线、市场、销售过程或客户的最终决策具有一定的自主权。利用先前的经验和在职培训来解决简单的任务。拥有解决问题所需的技术技能和分析思维。可以使用自己团队以外的多个内部资源来做出决定。 此级别的职位可能由个人贡献者担任，且其具有成熟的人际交往能力。向直接相关的同事和业务部门传达所提供的设计和协调服务。为新团队成员提供非正式指导。在简单的情况下向其他人解释复杂的信息。  基本资格  该岗位要求在领域具有较丰富的工作经验。学力水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历）  所需特性  优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够影响他人并领导小型团队。领导中等范围和影响的计划。能够同时协调多个项目。有效的问题识别和解决技能。可靠的分析和组织能力。  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

description: Description  Amazon Global Selling is a key initiative to achieve our vision to offer customers Earth’s largest selection. We provide businesses the opportunity to sell their goods on the Amazon platform worldwide. Each year, hundred thousands of CN businesses (manufacturers, resellers and brand owners) join our Marketplaces in 14 countries, adding billions of new products. More than 2 million sellers use this Marketplace, exceeding 60% of total Amazon unit sales. The China Global Selling New Seller Recruit (NSR) team aims to deliver on this vision by identifying massive China Sellers, bring their product selection to Amazon’s global marketplaces, and drive Seller success in WW platform.  The role we are hiring needs a data, process and result-oriented Seller Consultant who can learn quickly and build trust with various stakeholders in a dynamically changing environment. In this role, the candidate will be a key member of the China Global Selling New Seller Recruitment Team, reporting to NSR Post-launch Success Program Manager, and providing critical support to NSR team. The ideal candidate will have a high attention to detail, be able to work in a fast paced work environment, and have a track record of supporting process improvement. The position also requires strong data mining and analysis skill, strong communication skills and the ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with numerous stakeholders within the organization. S/he will also be able to think analytically, conducting deep dive analyzes to develop more efficient business and operational processes.  This role’s daily work includes but not limited to following scope: Own the on-time delivery of high quality work products that guides NSR teams to better focus on business priorities; Build trust, work closely with NSR teams and other stakeholders to drive key operational business processes, i.e., leads allocation, opportunity segmentation / prioritization, goal setting and performance management / reporting Seize cross-team project opportunities, segment Seller group which fit the criteria of project goal and develop action plan to drive feature adoption; Manage and allocate leads/feature opportunities for projects with defined workflows across NSR teams; Establish and unify the Seller promotion content together with marketing team and bridge the communications across NSR team; Leverage data tools such as Excel, SQL, Tableau and Salesforce.com in order to find out opportunities and initiatives with proposals on multiple Seller programs to drive NSR business  Basic Qualifications  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems Technology or similar related fields 2+ years of professional experience in sales operations, business information systems management, program management, or other related field Strong Excel skills, SQL or other data tools experience Excellent communication in both English and Mandarin Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and build partnerships with a wide range of stakeholders Attention to detail and strong time management skills are a must Desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment Fun to work with!  Preferred Qualifications  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Experience working with Salesforce.com (administrator experience a big plus) Other business software systems operations experience  Company - Amazon(Shanghai) Intl Trade Co  Job ID: A1716963
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: Company Description  Avery Dennison (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science company specializing in the design and manufacture of a wide variety of labeling and functional materials. The company’s products, which are used in nearly every major industry, include pressure-sensitive materials for labels and graphic applications; tapes and other bonding solutions for industrial, medical, and retail applications; tags, labels and embellishments for apparel; and radio frequency identification (RFID) solutions serving retail apparel and other markets. Headquartered in Glendale, California, the company employs more than 30,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Reported sales in 2019 were $7.1 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com. Avery Dennison Retail Branding and Information Solutions (RBIS), a global leader in apparel and footwear industry solutions, is a $1.6 billion division of Avery Dennison. We provide intelligent creative and sustainable solutions that elevate brands and accelerate performance throughout the global retail supply chain. We elevate brands through graphic tickets, tags and labels, embellishments and packaging solutions that enhance consumer appeal. We accelerate performance through radio frequency identification (RFID)-enabled inventory, loss prevention solutions, price management, global compliance and brand security solutions. Based in Westborough, Massachusetts, Avery Dennison RBIS responsibly serves the global marketplace with operations in 115 locations and 50 countries, across six continents. For more information, visit www.rbis.averydennison.com.  Job Description Be responsible for sales of products or solutions to main customers of assigned territory, and reach the sales target of assigned territory. Identify, analyse and explore market prospects, build up good relationships with potential customers. Build a sustainable relationship with customers and deliver our valued proposition to them. Delivery information about the market and competitors to the company. Generate reports in correct format according to customers request Maintain and update records of all existing customers and potential customers. Analyze problems, and provide methods to solve problems. Ensure the collection of Account Receivable on time Coordinate with Customer Service and Production Department to ensure timely delivery and solve complaints Qualifications College degree or above ,At least 2 years’ working experience in direct sales, sales experience in apparel industry preferred Good command of English and computer systems, skilled with MS software Good adaptability and willing to learn new knowledge. Easy-going personality, good communication skill Be able to work under pressure and accept very frequent travel Additional Information  AVERY DENNISON IS AN EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY PROVIDER. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or other protected status.

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  工作职责:  1、负责区域内中小客户销售策略制定及执行，通过电话或社交工具等方式完成所负责区域内销售计划；  2、主要通过电话的方式，负责所辖区域市场的开发、维护、运营、管理，促进公司业务可持续发展；  3、开拓新客户资源，同时维护老客户的购买需求；  4、收集、汇总、挖掘客户对于产品的潜在需求，负责销售区域数据及客户信息的收集、整理、分析；  5、与外部销售一起，根据公司经营目标制定销售计划方案（包括客户覆盖计划、销售跟进计划等），完成销售任务。  任职资格:  1、工作经验：2年以上电话销售工作经验，；  2、具备通过电话挖掘需求，开发商机的能力；  3、拥有客户财务部或人力资源部联络资源者优先；  4、具备RPA+AI、AI相关的软件订阅销售经验者优先；  知识/技能：  （1）具备快速学习新新产品解决方案能力；善于捕捉客户思想，快速匹配客户业务需求及产品优势，并根据这些信息提出新产品和服务的建议书，提出新颖、高效的销售手段；  （2）对不同行业客户的财务、人力资源、客服、呼叫中心业务及流程有一定的了解；  （3）强烈的竞争意识、开拓意识和创新意识，执行能力强；  （4）能承受压力、对自我有更高目标设定、擅长内外部沟通；  公司亮点：  1、公司属于高新技术企业；  2、RPA属于AI行业细分领域，行业发展前景好，职位发展空间大；  3、大牛多，学习氛围浓厚。  薪资可谈

jobTitle: Product Sales Specialist , Hong Kong and South China
description: Sr. Product Sales Specialist - Hong Kong & South China  We believe that when passionate people are able to spend less time struggling with technology, they can spend more time on what matters - like teaching children, running businesses, keeping airports safe, and connecting disaster victims with relief. That’s the real power of simplicity. Cisco Meraki is the leader in cloud-managed IT, thanks to our creative, inclusive, confident team that is driven to simplify technology so the world can simply work!  Cisco Meraki has grown to become an industry leader in the IT space, with over 350,000 customers and almost 2 million active networks and counting around the world. We have a comprehensive set of solutions which allows customers to seize new business opportunities and reduce operational costs. Meraki is known for simplifying powerful technology through our products and services - and for the people behind them. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products, and technology architecture are changing the face of networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.  As Sr. Level Product Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for positioning and selling Meraki revenue in the Hong Kong and South China market. Through ambitious prospecting, finding opportunities, and collaborating with Cisco account teams and partners, drive deals through close delivering on and exceeding quarterly quota. Success will be dependent not only on your ability to sell but also on the relationships you develop with regional channel partners and Cisco account teams. This is a high-energy position requiring you to be deeply motivated and results driven with a hunter mentality; it will also require someone who is equally comfortable working in a strategic and tactical capacity.  What You Will Do Passionately discover, manage and close deals and consistently remain highly results-oriented in the market space Maintain and lead detailed and accurate quarterly forecasting Work in a highly collaborative environment to team with Cisco Account Managers, Sales Engineers, Marketing, and Channel Partners to drive revenue and contribute to ambitious YoY growth rates Develop a predictable pipeline of short, mid, and long-term business. Help to exceed expectations by identifying impactful user cases that enable people to transform their businesses with Meraki solutions. Promote your customers and ecosystem around you on the concept of cloud-managed networking for digital business. Empower and build extended teams around you to unlock the power of Cisco’s Sales organization, customer base and partner organization. Show up every single day with willingness to learn, a real passion for customer delight, and a desire to have fun while improving the lives of others  Who You Are Speak fluent Cantonese and business level English. 8+ years technology sales experience in a field sales capacity. Consistent track record with detailed quota attainment. 3+ years over achievement Strong executive presence including communication and presentation skills with a high degree of comfort to large and small audiences. Knowledge within Industry and ability to make confident recommendations at C-level, business decision makers. Bachelor’s degree with exposure to Information Technology ( or equivalent). MBA desired. Based in Hong Kong or Guangzhou, China. 50% travel required.  Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.  Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
industries: Computer Hardware, Computer Software, and Computer Networking

jobTitle: Sales Management (Consumer Healthcare) – Sales Trainee, China Shanghai, 2022
description: Site Name: China - Shanghai - HuangPu District - The Headquarters Building  Posted Date: Sep 16 2021  工作内容： 覆盖GSK消费保健品全渠道的销售工作和培训，其中包括零售渠道，快消渠道及电商渠道等。 以消费者与客户需求为核心驱动推出创新健康解决方案，同时推动业务的增长。 持续发展和客户的合作伙伴关系，扩大公司和产品的市场影响力。 通过对渠道市场、客户和消费者的了解，建立所负责区域的销售策略并予以实施。 任职要求： 2022届应届毕业生 专业不限，拥有销售相关经验者优先 良好的学习能力，善于分析和解决问题 良好的沟通和人际关系处理能力，具有团队合作精神 对销售工作有热情，勇于接受挑战，并具有良好的抗压和自我修复能力 Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing.  Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies  GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.  致候选人的重要提示：  GSK招聘团队只会使用 @gsk.com 后缀的邮箱与您联系。若您收到任何声称来自GSK邀请您面试或请您提供任何个人信息的邮件，我们建议您留意发件人的邮箱地址，并谨慎回复。若您不确定您所收到的邮件是否来自GSK，请您通过chk.recruitment@gsk.com联系我们。

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Responsibilities Pre-sales activity will include delivery of technical expertise during the sales process including presentations, seminars, individual consultation, and hands-on demo experiments if needed. Executes technical and application based presentations on illumina’s sequencing and microarray platforms, applications and/or workflows. Post-sales activity includes working with post-installation customers providing additional workflow or applications training in strategically important labs. Supporting/assisting customers with sequencing assay design to accelerate adoption of targeted sequencing on illumina’s platforms. Attendance at tradeshows/conferences in relevant fields. Be the point person for dedicated illumina User Group Meetings in collaboration with field marketing and support team to provide sample to data workflow training Assists sales and field marketing on new strategic initiatives requiring both technical and market knowledge Works collaboratively with territory account managers, marketing, service and support teams to ensure effective account/customer management and communication through pre-sales, during and- post-sales cycle, including review and meeting account pull through targets and goals Escalates technical issues to Technical Support for possible resolution for strategically important labs. Develops and maintain positive relationships with customers in assigned territory Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.  Preferred Requirements Life science industry experience preferred Applied Market Knowledge is a plus Extensive experience and understanding of leading genetics technologies and how they can be applied. Detailed knowledge of technological developments and trends in the sequencing markets Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills in Mandarin and English. Strong negotiation skills and ability to persuade Ability to travel within region to carry out primary responsibilities. All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.  Preferred Experience/Education Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 0-2 years of related experience; or equivalent work experience. 岗位概述  Responsibilities 售前活动将包括销售过程中的技术知识演讲，如介绍演讲、研讨会、个别咨询等，在必要时，进行演示实验。 对因美纳测序和微阵列平台的应用或工作流程进行技术层面和应用层面的介绍。 售后活动包括与安装产品后的客户的协调，提供在具有重要战略意义的实验室中所需的工作流程或应用培训 支持/辅助客户的相关测序阵列设计，加快在客户因美纳平台上目标测序进程。 参加相关领域的展览会/大会。 作为与现场营销和支持团队合作的专项人员参加因美纳用户组会议，提供样品数据工作流程培训。 提供销售或现场营销新战略项目时所需有关技术和市场知识。 与区域客户经理、营销、服务和支持团队合作工作，保证有效的大客户/客户管理以及负责售前、售中和售后过程的沟通，包括回访和会面已经取得成果或达成目标的客户。 作为技术支持提供技术升级，为具有重要战略意义的实验室提供可能的解决方案。 提升和维护责任区域内客户的良好关系。 以上所列的任务和职责是本岗位的基本功能。然而，各种商务条件下可能需要完成额外的任务和职责。  Preferred Requirements 有生命科学行业经验者优先 有应用市场知识者加分 具有领先的遗传学技术及其应用方面的丰富经验和充分理解 具有技术发展和测序市场趋势的详细知识 优秀的中文普通话和英文口头和书面交流和介绍演讲技能 良好的谈判技巧和说服能力 能在负责区域内出差并完成主要职责 Preferred Experience/Education 科学学科的硕士以上学历（分子生物学、遗传学、或基因组学和/或生物信息学优先）

description: Company Description  At Infobip we dream big. Last year, over half of the world’s population interacted with businesses through the Infobip platform. It didn’t happen by chance: through 50+ offices on 6 continents, we are truly committed to helping our 200 000 enterprise clients reach and engage mobile users. Join us in driving the continuous success of Infobip by creating products that our customers love.  Job Description  Why is this role important at Infobip?  As Sales Development Representative you will have the opportunity to be our first impression on all prospective clients in the APAC market. Our vision of greatness in a Sales Development Representative is a brand ambassador that opens doors to all of our target clients, meaningfully filling the top of the Sales funnel, with a competitive drive to succeed.  You know you are doing a good job when you are: Reach out leads and follow up as required Managing Outbound leads, setting up meetings with Account Executives (A and B). Work closely with Enterprise Sales team, defining the best strategy to approach new leads and focus on target verticals. Provide ongoing feedback to the sales and marketing department for continuous process optimization. Use and maintain the Salesforce for data quality. Achieve defined KPI goals. Accept feedback and training to keep continuous development with Inside Sales Team Leader and peers. Identify customer segment and vertical and/or need early in discussion in order to route properly to the Sales Enterprise Team in the region. Support Sales Team with outbound prospect accounts into the A/B segment. Qualifications  More about you: Experience with lead development from first contact of target customers. Minimum 1 year of experience in sales roles. Good sales-oriented communication skills. Robust negotiation skills. Passionate about creating meaningful connections. Creative problem solver with a proven ability to think strategically. Strong administrative and organizational skills, with a focus on metrics supported results. Additional Information  Why our employees choose us (and stay)? Awesome clients – We serve and partner with the majority of the leading mobile operators, OTTs, brands, banks, social networks, aggregators and many more. You can look forward to working with the likes of Viber, Zendesk, O2 and… Seriously, our clients are really cool. Work with the world’s leading companies and impact how they communicate with their users! Opportunity knocks. Often. – Being a part of a growing company in a growing industry – we challenge you not to grow! Whether it’s horizontal, vertical, or angular, we want to support the path that you want to carve. Learn as you grow – Starting from the Orientation Week as an onboarding program, to internal education, education resources, e-learning to external educations, we invest heavily in employee learning and development. Connect globally – Work with people from different countries, participate in the biggest IT and Telecom events, join us in our Summer Connect conference in Croatia. We put the “global” in globalisation. Pay & Perks – Competitive salary, travel allowances, expatriate compensation packages for your business trips, rewards and holiday bonuses, a team taking care of all the equipment you need, team buildings and other organised activities, company library, organised sports, kitchen stocked with the usual suspects… Talk about a balanced lifestyle! By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.
